sourceString: I order that Californians working in these 16 critical infrastructure sectors may continue their work because of the importance of these sectors to Californians' health and well-being.
targetString: Ndagira wano nti abantu b’omu California bonna abakolera mu bitongole ebyo eby’omugaso 16 bagende mu maaso n’emirimu gyabwe olw’omugaso gw’ebitongole ebyo mu by’Obulamu bw’abantu b’omu California.

sourceString: This Order is being issued to protect the public health of Californians.
targetString: Ekiragiro kino kiteereddwawo olw’okukuuma ebyobulamu bw’abantu b’omu California.

sourceString: The California Department of Public Health looks to establish consistency across the state in order to ensure that we mitigate the impact of COVID-19.
targetString: Ekitongole kya California eky’Ebyobulamu kifuba okulaba nti ebikolebwa wonna mu ssaza bye bimu era n’okufuba okutangira okukosa okuva ku COVID-19.

sourceString: Our goal is simple, we want to bend the curve, and disrupt the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ekigendererwa kyaffe kyangu, twagala okukkakkanya n’okutaataaganya ensaasaana y’akawuka.

sourceString: The supply chain must continue, and Californians must have access to such necessities as food, prescriptions, and health care.
targetString: Akajegere k’okusaasaanya ebyamaguzi kalina okweyongera okutambula era abantu b’omu California balina okufuna ebyetaago ng’emmere, eddagala n’obujjjanjabi.

sourceString: When people need to leave their homes or places of residence, whether to obtain or perform the functions above, or to otherwise facilitate authorized necessary activities, they should at all times practice social distancing.
targetString: Abantu bwe baba nga beetaaga okuva mu maka gaabwe oba gye basula, okuweerezebwa oba okuweereza ku mirimu egyo egyogeddwako waggulu, oba okuyambako mu mirimu egikkirizibwa egyetaagisa, buli kiseera balina okwewa amabanga.

sourceString: 2) The healthcare delivery system shall prioritize services to serving those who are the sickest and shall prioritize resources, including personal protective equipment, for the providers providing direct care to them.
targetString: 2) Enkola y’obujjanjabi ejja kuweereza ng’essa ku mwanjo abo abayi ennyo era mu kukozesa ebyokwesabika abajjanjabi abalabirira obutereevu abalwadde be bajja okussibwa ku mwanjo.

sourceString: 3) The Office of Emergency Services is directed to take necessary steps to ensure compliance with this Order.
targetString: 3) Omukungu w’Obuweereza obw’Amangu alagirwa wano okukola ekyetaagisa okulaba nti Ekiragiro kino kissibwa mu nkola.

sourceString: 4) This Order shall be enforceable pursuant to California law, including, but not limited to, Government Code section 8665.
targetString: 4) Ekiragiro kino kijja kussibwa mu nkola okusnziira ku Mateeka ga California omuli n’Akatundu ka Gavumenti 8665.

sourceString: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that as soon as hereafter possible, this Order be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and that widespread publicity and notice be given of this Order.
targetString: KYONGERA OKULAGIRWA WANO nti amangu ddala nga bwe kisoboka wano, Ekiragiro kino kiwandiikibwe mu Woofiisi ya Minisita akola ku Nsonga z’omunda mu ggwanga era kisaasaanyizibwe wonna nga bwe kisoboka.

sourceString: This Order is not intended to, and does not, create any rights or benefits, substantive or procedural, enforceable at law or in equity, against the State of California, its agencies, departments, entities, officers, employees, or any other person.
targetString: Ekiragiro kino kiruubirira naye nga tekigenderera, kutondawo ddembe oba miganyulo, kutondawo mitendera oba tteeka lissibwa mu nkola oba lyenkanankana n’eryo ery’Eggwanga lya California, ebitongole byalyo, aboobuyinza, abakozi, oba omuntu omulala yenna.

sourceString: IN WITNESS WHEREOF I have hereunto set my hand and caused the Great Seal of the State of California to be affixed this 19th day of March 2020.
targetString: OKUSOBOLA OKUKIKAKASA nkitaddeko omukono ne Sitampu Enkulu ey’Essaza lya California olwaleero nga 19 Ogwokusatu 2020.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 virus is the cause of COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019), a contagious respiratory disease that was first identified in December 2019, in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Akawuka ka SARS-CoV-2 ke kaleeta COVID-19 (obulwadde bwa coronavirus 2019), obulwadde bw’omuyungiro gw’okussa obusiigibwa obwasooka okuzuulibwa mu Deesemba wa 2019, mu Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: The disease is a type of coronavirus, the same family that includes SARS, MERS, and some varieties of the common cold.
targetString: Obulwadde obwo kika ky’akawuka ka coronavirus, nga kali mu kika kye kimu omuli SARS, MERS, n’ebika bya ssennyiga ebimu ebimanyiddwa.

sourceString: It was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Ekitongole kya World Health Organization (WHO) kyabulangirira ng’ekirwadde ekikambwe nga 11 Ogwokusatu 2020.

sourceString: While much about COVID-19 is still unknown, preliminary data suggests that it is more virulent and contagious than the seasonal flu, and less virulent but more contagious than SARS and MERS.
targetString: Newankubadde nga bingi ebikwata ku COVID-19 tebimanyiddwa, ebizuuliddwawo biraga nti bwa bulabe nnyo era busaasaana mangu okusinga ssennyiga owa bulijjo, naye ate si bwa bulabe nnyo kusinga SARS ne MERS newankubadde nga busaasaana nnyo okubusinga

sourceString: Older people and those with underlying conditions are the most at risk of serious complications including death.
targetString: Abantu abakuliridde n’abo abasangiddwa n’obulwadde obulala be basinga okuba mu bulabe okufuna obukosefu obw’amaanyi omuli n’okufa.

sourceString: Due to the spread of the disease, you are advised not to travel unless necessary, to avoid being infected, quarantined, or stranded by changing restrictions and cancelled flights.
targetString: Olw’okusaasana kw’obulwadde buno, osabibwa obutatambula okuggyako nga tekyewalika, okusobola okwetangira okusiigibwa obulwadde, ng’oteekeddwa mu kalantiini, oba okusoberwa olw’obukwakkulizo obukyukakyuka n’okusazaamu entambula z’ennyonyi.

sourceString: Avoid crowded places whenever possible.
targetString: Weewale ebifo ebirimu abantu abangi nga bwe kisoboka.

sourceString: This is not just to protect you, but also those you come in contact with.
targetString: Kino si kya kukuuma ggwe wekka, naye n’abantu b’okwatagana nabo.

sourceString: As it happens, you probably aren't missing much by staying home, as many attractions around the world are closing their doors to avoid spreading the disease.
targetString: Ekituufu kiri nti, oboolyawo tolina ky’osubwa nnyo singa obeera osigadde ewaka, kubanga ebintu ebisikiriza okwetoloola ensi yonna biggaddewo okutangira okusaasaanya obulwadde.

sourceString: If you do need to travel, take precautions as you would for other infections: wash your hands frequently, avoid touching your face, cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and avoid contact with sick people.
targetString: Bw’oba oyagala okutambula, weegendereze nga bwe wandikoze ku ndwadde endala: naaba mu ngalo buli kiseera, weewale okwekwata mu maaso, kololera oba nyiriza mu lukokola oba akapapula akeerongoosa, era weewale okukwatagana n’abantu abalwadde.

sourceString: Before traveling, read up on the extensive and fast-changing array of travel restrictions that have been imposed around the world.
targetString: Nga tonnatambula, sooka osome nnyo ku nkyukakyuka ezibeerawo buli kaseera ku bukwakkulizo bw’okutambula obuteereddwawo okwetooloola ensi.

sourceString: After travel, monitor your health and consider self-isolation for two weeks to avoid transmitting the disease to others.
targetString: Bw’odda oluvannyuma lw’okutambula, londoola obulamu bwo era olowooze ku kweyawula okumala wiiki bbiri okwewala okusaasaanya obulwadde eri abalala.

sourceString: Transportation from long-distance passenger flights to local buses has been curtailed or completely shut down in many countries due to low demand or government orders.
targetString: Okutambuliza abantu ku baasi z’omu kitundu ababa batambulidde ku nnyonyi eŋŋendo empanvu kusaliddwako oba kiggyiddwawo ddala mu mawanga agasinga olw’abazikozesa okukendeera oba olw’ebiragiro bya gavumenti.

sourceString: Many international and regional borders are closed.
targetString: Ensalo ttabamawanga ne ttababitundu ezisinga ziggaddwawo.

sourceString: If you are away from home, and especially if you are in another country, consider returning home as soon as possible; this may get even more difficult as restrictions continue to change.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’ovudde ewaka, naddala singa oba ng’oli mu ggwanga ddala, lowooza ku ky’okudda eka amangu ddala; kino kiyinza okweyongera okukaluba olw’ensonga nti obukwakkulizo bweyongera okukyusibwakyusibwa.

sourceString: In some cases it may simply not be possible, even if you're healthy and meet the legal requirements for entry.
targetString: Ebiseera ebimu, kiyinza obutasobokera ddala, ne bw’oba ng’oli mulamu ate nga n’ebisaanyizo byonna ebikuyingiza mu ggwanga obirina.

sourceString: If you can't find a way back to your country, contact your nearest embassy or consulate for assistance.
targetString: Bw’oba olemereddwa okuddayo mu ggwanga lyo, tuukirira ekitebe ky’eggwanga lyo ekikuli okumpi osobole okuyambibwa.

sourceString: They may be able to organize an evacuation, identify non-regularly scheduled flights, or give you an emergency loan to pay for transport.
targetString: Bayinza okusobola okukutegekera engeri y’okukuzzaayo, okukufunira ennyonyi ezitali za lukale, oba okukuwola ssente z’entambula ez’amangu.

sourceString: In case they can't, make preparations in case you need to stay where you are for an extended period.
targetString: Bwe balemererwa, weetegeke singa kiba kikwetaagisa okusigala w’oli okumala ebbanga eryeyongeramu.

sourceString: If you do find a way back home, be prepared that it may be expensive, inconvenient, and have unusual restrictions (such as no checked baggage).
targetString: Bw’oba ofunye engeri y’okudda ewaka, weetegeke nti kiyinza okuba eky’ebbeeyi ennyo, ekitaataaganya, n’okubaako obukwakkulizo obutali bwa bulijjo (okugeza ennyonyi obuteetikka migugu).

sourceString: As of early April 2020, the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 is approaching one million.
targetString: Bwe gwatuukira Ogwokuna 2020, omuwendo gw’abantu abakakasibwa okubeera n’obulwadde bwa COVID-19 gwali gukunukkiriza akakadde kalamba.

sourceString: Though the disease started in mainland China, it has spread around the world and China has fewer confirmed cases and deaths than several other countries.
targetString: Newankubadde obulwadde bwatandikira mu China, busaasaanidde ensi yonna era China yo erina abalwadde batonoko n’abafudde okusinga amawanga agamu amalala.

sourceString: Europe is the new epicenter of the pandemic.
targetString: Ssemazinga wa Bulaaya kaakati y’asingamu nawookeera ono.

sourceString: All but a handful of countries have reported at least one case, with the highest numbers of reported cases in the United States, Spain, Italy, Germany, France, mainland China, Iran, and the United Kingdom.
targetString: Kyenkana buli ggwanga ng’oggyeko ag’olubatu gafunyeeyo waakiri omulwadde omu, ng’omuwendo gw’abalwadde ogusinga obunene guli mu United States, Italy, Germany, France, China, Iran, ne United Kingdom.

sourceString: Local transmission is established in many countries in all major inhabited regions of the world except some Pacific island nations.
targetString: Okusaasaana kw’obulwadde munda mu mawanga kukakasiddwa mu mawanga mangi mu bitundu ebikulu ebibeeramu abantu mu nsi yonna okuggyako amawanga agali mu bitundu by’ebizinga bya Pacific.

sourceString: (See updates from the WHO.)
targetString: (Laba amawulire okuva ku WHO.)

sourceString: The full extent of the spread is uncertain, due in part to limited testing.
targetString: Obugazi bw’okusaasaana butankanibwa, olw’ensonga nti okukebera kutono.

sourceString: Many countries are experiencing a severe shortage of test kits, and the authorities have not been able to test everybody who is at high risk, so the real number of cases is probably much higher than the official one.
targetString: Amawanga mangi tegalina bikozesebwa kukebera, era n’abakwatibwako tebannaba kufuna busobozi kukebera buli muntu ali mu katyabaga akanene okufuna obulwadde, noolwekyo, omuwendo gw’abalwadde gwennyini guyinza okuba nga munene nnyo okusinga ogwo ogumanyiddwa.

sourceString: Countries also differ in their testing and reporting practices, so comparisons of the number of reported cases do not tell the full story of how the epidemic has progressed in different areas.
targetString: Era amawanga gaawukanya enkola zaago mu kukebera n’okufulumya ebikwata ku bulwadde, noolwekyo okugeraageranya omuwendo gw’abalwadde ogufulumiziddwa tekiraga kifaananyi kituufu ku ngeri obulwadde gye busaasaanye mu bitundu eby’enjawulo.

sourceString: The virus is transmitted through respiratory droplets and through objects.
targetString: Akawuka kasaasaanyizibwa okuyita mu matondo g’omuyungiro gw’okussa n’okuyita ku bintu.

sourceString: The coronavirus is a relatively large virus, meaning it is not truly airborne: it will settle down in respiratory droplets.
targetString: Akawuka ka coronavirus kawuka kagazi, ekitegeeza nti tekasaasaanira mu mpewo mwokka: kabeera ne mu luzzizzi lw’omu nnyindo ng’omuntu assa.

sourceString: Staying two metres (six feet) away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.
targetString: Okubeera mmita bbiri (fuuti mukaaga) okuva ku bantu abalala kitera okuba nga kimala okutangira okusiigibwa akawuka okuyita mu ngeri eno.

sourceString: Transmission from objects can happen, for example, if someone sneezes, touches a doorknob, and then other people touch the doorknob and then touch their faces.
targetString: Kisoboka okukwatibwa akawuka okuva ku bintu, okugeza, singa omuntu ayasimula, akwata ku munyolo gw’oluggi, abantu abalala nabo ne bakwata ku munyolo ogwo ate ne beekwata mu maaso.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours and on plastic for up to 3 days.
targetString: Akawuka ka SARS-CoV-2 kayinza okumala ku lubaawo essaawa 24 ne ku pulasitiika ennaku 3.

sourceString: Transmission via the fecal–oral route may also be possible.
targetString: Busobola n’okusaasaana okuyita mu kulya obubi.

sourceString: Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms, though to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Obujulizi obuliwo bulaga nti COVID-19 osobola okumusiiga ne bw’oba tolina bubonero bwonna, newankubadde nga okumanya oba nga kino kisoboka kyenkana ki kikyanoonyerezebwako.

sourceString: Common symptoms include a fever, dry cough, and fatigue.
targetString: Obubonero obwa bulijjo mulimu olusujjasujja, ekifuba ekitakutuka n’ekimenyoomenyo.

sourceString: Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath, a sore throat, headache, muscle pain, or sputum production.
targetString: Obubonero obulala obutali bwa maanyi mulimu okuziyira, amabwa mu bulago, okulumwa omutwe, okulumwa ennyingo, oba okufuna akakolondolwa.

sourceString: Some patients have very mild symptoms, similar to a cold.
targetString: Abalwadde abamu bafuna obubonero butono nnyo, obwekuusa ku ssennyiga.

sourceString: Serious complications include pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, and multi-organ failure leading to disability or death.
targetString: Obuvune obw’amaanyi mulimu lubyamira, okukaluubirizibwa okw’amaanyi mu kussa, n’okulemererwa kw’ebitundu by’omubiri eby’enjawulo ekiyinza okuviirako obulemu oba okufa.

sourceString: About 80% of infections result in mild symptoms, while the remaining may result in hospitalization.
targetString: Abalwadde nga ebitundu 80% bafuna obubonero obutonotono, so ng’ate abasigadde basobola n’okuweebwa ebitanda mu ddwaliro.

sourceString: Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals, most of whom are elderly with underlying health conditions.
targetString: Abantu abalowoozebwa okuba nga bafudde obulwadde buno bali wakati w’ebitundu 1 ne 3 ku kikumi, abasinga obungi nga bakadde abasangiddwa n’ebirwadde ebirala.

sourceString: The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70 but significantly lower for those under 40.
targetString: Abantu abasinga okufa beebo abali waggulu w’emyaka 70 so ng’aomuwendo mutono ddala ogw’abo abali wansi w’emyaka 40.

sourceString: Those most at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications are the elderly and those with weakened immune systems or underlying health conditions like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer.
targetString: Abasinga okuba mu bulabe bw’okukwatibwa ekirwadde kya COVID-19 wamu n’okukosebwa ennyo be bakadde n’abo abalina abasirikale b’omubiri abanafuye oba abasangiddwa n’ebirwadde ebirala nga obulwadde bw’omutima, sukaali, entunnunsi, obulwadde bw’ekiwanga, ne kookolo.

sourceString: Not many cases are reported in children and most of these are mild or moderate, though a significant fraction do get pneumonia.
targetString: Obulwadde tebunnalabibwa nnyo mu baana abato era abazuuliddwa boolesa obubonero butono ddala oba si bwa maanyi, newankubadde ng’abasinga bafuna lubyamira.

sourceString: Occupationally, health care workers have higher risk compared to others with clusters of disease among workers and in health care settings.
targetString: Mu by’emirimu, abajjanjabi balina omukisa gwa waggulu okukwatibwa obulwadde okusinga ku bannaabwe abakola n’abantu abalina endwadde endala nga nabo bakolera mu bifo ebijjanjabirwamu.

sourceString: The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms (incubation period) is typically between 2 and 14 days, though there has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure.
targetString: Ebbanga wakati w’okufuna akawuka n’okweyoleka kw’obubonero (ebbanga ly’okwaluza) liri wakati w’ennaku 2 ne 14, newankubadde waliwo omulwadde omu agambibwa okuba nti obubonero bweyoleka luvannyuma lwa nnaku 27 ng’amaze okufuna akawuka.

sourceString: As of February 2020, the period of infectiousness is unknown, but is likely most significant when people are symptomatic.
targetString: Bwe zaatuukira Ogwokubiri 2020, ng’ekiseera omuntu ky’asobola okumala ng’asiiga akawuka tekimanyiddwa, naye kirabika kibeerawo nnyo ng’abantu batandise okulaga obubonero.

sourceString: There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms, although to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Waliwo obukakafu nti obulwadde busaasaanyizibwa abantu abatalaga bubonero, naye ng’obunene bw’ensonga eno tebumanyiddwa bulungi.

sourceString: It is unclear whether it is possible to be reinfected with the virus after recovering from it the first time around.
targetString: Tekyekakasia oba ng’omuntu awonye obulwadde omulundi ogusooka asobola okuddamu n’asiigibwa akawuka.

sourceString: Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear, but there is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients.
targetString: Obukosefu obusigalawo okumala ebbanga mu bantu abassuuse tebumanyiddwa, naye waliwo obukakafu nti amawuggwe g’abantu abamu abassuuse ganafuwa.

sourceString: Testing for the virus usually consists of a swab inserted through the nose or a throat swab which is analysed in a laboratory for the virus.
targetString: Mu kukebera akawuka, oyisibwa akawero mu nnyindo oba mu mumiro oluvannyuma ne byekebejjebwa mu ggezeserezo.

sourceString: The current "gold standard" test involves extracting the genetic material from the sample and analysing it for known genetic markers of the virus.
targetString: Enkola eriwo esinga okumanyibwa mu kukebera erimu okuggya obutaffaali bw’endagabutonde mu sampolo, ne bwekenneenyezebwa okulaba oba mulimu emikululo gy’obuwuka bw’onna obuli mu butaffaali.

sourceString: There is no established test assessing for the virus or antibodies in the blood, although tests are being developed.
targetString: Tewali kukebera kawuka oba basirikale ba mubiri kuteereddwawo nga bakebera musaayi, newankubadde ng’okukebera okw’engeri eyo kuli mu kukulaakulanyizibwa.

sourceString: There is no test to establish immunity to the virus.
targetString: Tewali kukebera kusobola kulaga nti omuntu alina obusibage ku kawuka.

sourceString: Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel unnecessarily amid the pandemic.
targetString: Gavumenti nnyingi okwetooloola ensi balabudde bannansi baabwe obutamala gatambula mu kiseera kya nnawookeera.

sourceString: Lots of airlines and package holidays are making it easy for you by waiving cancellation and change fees.
targetString: Kkampuni z’ennyonyi ezisinga n’abakola ku by’empummula banguyirizzaako abantu nga baggyawo ssente ezitanzibwa olw’okusazaamu oba okukyusaamu okutambula.

sourceString: Particularly avoid cruise ship travel.
targetString: Okusingira ddala weewale okutambulira ku mmeeri.

sourceString: Older travelers and those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk, such as long plane flights, visits to crowded places, and especially cruises, even outside of severely affected areas.
targetString: Abasaabaze abakadde n’abo abaasangibwa n’ebirwadde be basinga okuba n’obusobozi okusiigibwa era basaanye beewale okutambula okubateeka mu buzibu, okugeza ng’okutambulira mu nnyonyi eŋŋendo empanvu, okukyalira ebifo ebirimu abantu abangi, naddala okutambulira ku mmeeri, ne bwe kiba wabbali w’ebifo ebikoseddwa ennyo.

sourceString: In affected areas, most experts recommend a practice known as social distancing.
targetString: Mu bifo ebikoseddwa, abakugu bawagira enkola emanyiddwa nga tonsemberera.

sourceString: This means minimising contact with others by keeping a distance of six feet or two meters from them and avoiding gathering together in groups.
targetString: Kino kitegeeza okukendeeza ku kusemberera abantu abalala ng’olekawo ebbanga lya fuuti mukaaga oba mmita bbiri okuva ku munno n’okwewala okukuŋŋaanira mu bibinja.

sourceString: Some areas permit small groups; others prohibit all group gatherings.
targetString: Ebifo ebimu bikkiriza obubinja obutonotono; ebirala byo bigaanira ddala okukuŋŋaana okw’engeri yonna.

sourceString: Measures you are encouraged to take include working from home whenever possible, avoiding crowds and avoiding leaving your home unless absolutely necessary.
targetString: Ebintu by’okubirizibwa okukola mulimu okukolera ewaka bwe kiba kisoboka, okwewala ebibinja n’okwewala okuva mu maka go okuggyako nga tekyewalika.

sourceString: If you must go out, try to stay at least 2 meters (6 feet) away from other people.
targetString: Bwe kiba nti oteekeddwa okutambula, fuba okulekawo ebbanga lya mmita 2 (fuuti 6) okuva ku bantu abalala.

sourceString: In many places these measures are required.
targetString: Mu bifo ebisinga obungi, enkola zino zeetaagisa.

sourceString: Follow hygiene practices like for flu prevention.
targetString: Goberera enkola z’obuyonjo nga ezigobererwa okutangira ssennyiga.

sourceString: Frequently wash your hands with soap and warm water, and then dry your hands on a clean towel.
targetString: Naaba mu ngalo ne ssabbuuni wamu n’amazzi agabuguma buli kiseera, era engalo zo ozikaze n’akagoye akayonjo.

sourceString: As coronaviruses are enveloped viruses, washing your hands with soap kills the virus by disrupting the mostly fat-based viral envelope.
targetString: Engeri gye kiri nti obuwuka bwa coronavirus busabikiddwa, okunaaba mu ngalo ne ssabbuuni kitta obuwuka okuyita mu kwabya olububi omusabikiddwa obuwuka obwo.

sourceString: Effective hand washing requires rubbing your hands for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Okunaaba engalo obulungi olina okuzikuuta waakiri okumala obutikitiki 20.

sourceString: Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin (so don't skip that step, and don't share towels).
targetString: Okusiimuula engalo zo kiggyako obuwuka obumu okuva ku lususu lwo (noolwekyo tobuuka mutendera ogwo, naye togabana busiimuula).

sourceString: If soap and water are not available, then use a >60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
targetString: Bwe kiba nti tewali ssabuuni na mazzi, awo kozesa eddagala erinaaba mu ngalo okutta obuwuka nga lirimu ebitundu ebitakka wansi wa 60% eby’omwenge.

sourceString: Alcohol is a quick germ-killer, but it's not quite instant, so this still requires the same 20 seconds of rubbing your hands together, making sure that every single scrap of skin gets wet, and then you have to wait about another minute, for the alcohol to completely dry.
targetString: Omwenge gutta mangu obuwuka naye nga tegukolerawo bwekityo nagwo gwetaaga obutikitiki 20 ng’okuuba engalo zo ng’ofuba okulaba nti buli kanyomero ka lususu lwo katoba era olindeko eddakiika endala ng’emu, omwenge ogwo gukale bulungi.

sourceString: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with your hands.
targetString: Weewale okukwata mu maaso go, ennyindo n’emimwa gyo.

sourceString: Most people touch their faces every few minutes, all day long.
targetString: Abantu abasinga beekwata mu maaso buli luvanyuma lw’eddakiika entonotono, olunaku lwonna.

sourceString: Try to do this less, and try to wash your hands before touching your face.
targetString: Kino kikole emirundi mitono ddala era gezaako okunaaba engalo zo nga tonnakikola.

sourceString: Also, try to avoid touching surfaces you don't have to touch in the first place, at least with your bare hands.
targetString: Mu ngeri y’emu, weewale okukwata ku bintu by’otolina kukwatako, waakiri tobikwata na ngalo nga si nsabike.

sourceString: Cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and then immediately throw away the tissue and wash your hands.
targetString: Kolola era oyasimulire mu lukokola lwo oba mu kapapula akakozesebwa okwerongoosa, era amangu ago okasuule ate onaabe mu ngalo.

sourceString: Don't stand or sit near people who might be sick.
targetString: Toyimirira oba kutuula kumpi na muntu ayinza okuba omulwadde.

sourceString: Stay at least one meter – and ideally two meters (six feet) – away.
targetString: Weesuule waakiri mmita emu – naye n’gokusinga mmita bbiri (fuuti mukaaga) – okuva ku muntu omulala.

sourceString: As a quick way to eyeball this distance, imagine that you and the other person both reached your hands towards each other.
targetString: Ng’engeri ennyangu ey’okunnyonnyolamu ebbanga lino, kitwale nti ggwe n’omuntu omulala mwembi mwegololedde emikono.

sourceString: Could you touch the other person's hand without taking a step towards that person?
targetString: Osobola okukwata ku mukono gw’omuntu omulala nga toseetudde kigere kweyongera gy’ali?

sourceString: If the answer is yes, then you're too close.
targetString: Bwe kiba nga kisoboka, kitegeeza nti musembereganye nnyo.

sourceString: Clean objects and surfaces that a lot of people touch, such as doorknobs, phones, and television remotes with regular household cleaner.
targetString: Yonja ebintu n’ekungulu kw’ebintu abantu kwe bakwata, gamba nga eminyolo, essimu, ne limooti za ttivvi ng’okozesa bye muyonjesa ewaka ebya bulijjo.

sourceString: Disinfect the surfaces with a suitable disinfectant, such as diluted household bleach.
targetString: Tta obuwuka obuli kungulu ku bintu n’ekitta obuwuka ekisaanidde, gamba ng’ebirungo ebipeeruusa nga bijaabuluddwa.

sourceString: Stay home when you are sick, and avoid contact with other people until your symptoms are gone.
targetString: Sigala ewaka nga oli mulwadde, era weewale okukwatagana n’abantu abalala okutuusa ng’obubonero bw’obulwadde bugenze.

sourceString: Do not share personal items that come into contact with saliva, such as toothbrushes, eating utensils, drinks, water bottles, and towels.
targetString: Togabana bintu byo ebikwatagana n’amalusu, gamba nga obusenya, ebiriirwako, eby’okunywa, eccupa z’amazzi, ne tawulo.

sourceString: The practice of serving yourself from a common plate with your own chopsticks, common in China, should be avoided.
targetString: Enkola ey’okuliira ku ssowaani emu newankubadde ng’oliisa buti bwo, ekirabikira ennyo mu China, kisaanye okwewalibwa.

sourceString: Greet people without touching them.
targetString: Buuza abantu nga tobakutteeko

sourceString: Avoid hugs, kisses, handshakes, fist bumps, and any other contact.
targetString: Weewale okugwa mu kifuba, okunywegera, okukwata mu ngalo, okubonga, n’okukwatagana okulala kwonna.

sourceString: If it's impossible to avoid contact, then wash your hands both before and after.
targetString: Bwe kiba nga tekisoboka kwewala kukwatagana na bantu balala, olwo nno naaba mu ngalo zo nga tonnakwatagana nabo n’oluvannyuma ng’omaze.

sourceString: It won't protect you from the coronavirus, but it will partially protect you from the flu, which remains a greater risk than COVID-19 in many areas.
targetString: Tekijja kukutangira kawuka ka corona, naye kijja kuyambako okukutangira sennyiga, alabika nga wa bulabe bwa maanyi n’okusinga COVID-19 mu bitundu bingi.

sourceString: This also saves you from unnecessary worry if you get the flu and think it might be the coronavirus.
targetString: Kino era kikutaasa okweraliikirira okuteetaagisa singa ofuna sennyiga n’olowooza nti oboolyawo kawuka ka corona.

sourceString: If you are elderly or otherwise in a high-risk group and can be vaccinated for pneumonia, get that vaccination.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’okaddiye oba ng’oli mu ttuluba lyabo abanguyirwa okukosebwa ng’osobola okugemebwa lubyamira, genda ogemebwe.

sourceString: It won't protect you from viral pneumonia from COVID-19, but some COVID-19 patients have died of bacterial pneumonia that attacked their weakened lungs, so a pneumonia vaccination could save your life.
targetString: Tekiggya kukutangira kufuna lubyamira ava ku COVID-19, naye abalwade ba COVID-19 abamu bafudde lubyamira eyakwata amawuge gaabwe aganafuye, noolwekyo okukugema lubyamira kyanditaasa obulamu bwo.

sourceString: Wearing masks is recommended for those who are suspected of carrying of disease and those who are in close contact with those infected.
targetString: Okwambala obukookolo kisembebwa eri abo abasuubirwa okuba nga balina obulwadde wamu n’abo abasemberera abalwadde.

sourceString: For those who are asymptomatic, the WHO does not recommend masks, though some national governments do.
targetString: Eri abo abatalina kabonero konna, ekibiina kya WHO tekibasemba kwambala bukookolo, newankubadde nga gavumenti ezimu zikikaka.

sourceString: Wearing a mask of some kind is required in some countries and cities in an effort to reduce community transmission.
targetString: Okwambala akakookolo ak’engeri yonna kya buwaze mu nsi ezimu n’ebibuga mu kaweefube w’okukendeeza okusaasaana kw’akawuka mu bantu.

sourceString: There are worldwide shortages of surgical masks.
targetString: Waliwo ebbula ly’obukookolo obukozesebwa mu kujjanjaba okwetoloola ensi yonna.

sourceString: If you do wear a mask, make sure to use it correctly.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’oyambadde akakookolo, kakasa nti okakozesa bulungi.

sourceString: The mask should cover your nose and mouth and fit without gaps.
targetString: Akakookolo kalina okubikka ennyindo yo n’omumwa ne kagyako bulungi awatali kulekawo mabanga.

sourceString: Wash your hands before putting on the mask and avoid touching the mask while wearing it.
targetString: Naaba mu ngalo nga tonnayambala kakookolo era weewale okukwata ku kakookolo ng’omaze okukambala.

sourceString: If you do touch it, wash your hands immediately afterwards.
targetString: Bw’oba okakutteko, naaba mu ngalo amangu ddala nga waakamala okukakwatako.

sourceString: When the mask becomes damp, discard and replace it.
targetString: Akakookolo singa kabisiwala, kasuule ofune akalala.

sourceString: Remove it from the back, throw it away, and then wash your hands.
targetString: Kaggyeemu ng’okayisa mabega, okasuule, bw’omala onaabe mu ngalo.

sourceString: Remember that masks are not a substitute for good hygiene: continue to wash your hands frequently.
targetString: Jjukira nti obukookolo tebutegeeza nti olwo omaze mu by’obuyonjo: genda mu maaso n’okunaaba mu ngalo buli kiseera.

sourceString: Don't stock up on masks if you don't need them.
targetString: Totereka bukookolo bungi bw’oba nga tobwetaaga.

sourceString: Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.
targetString: Ebbula ly’obukookolo litegeeza nti abajjanjabi bakaluubirirwa okubufuna, ekiteeka obulamu bwa buli muntu mu matigga.

sourceString: That includes N95 respirators, which are not recommended for the general public – these are specialist equipment which must be fitted to be optimally effective.
targetString: Kino kizingiramu n’ebyuma ebiyambako mu kussa ebya N95, ebitasembebwa kukozesebwa buli muntu - bino byuma bya kikugu ebiteekeddwa okuteegekebwa mu butuufu bwabyo okusobola okukola obulungi.

sourceString: Leave them for healthcare workers.
targetString: Birekere abajjanjabi.

sourceString: Avoid crowded areas, especially enclosed areas without much air circulation, such as conferences, performances, shopping malls, public transportation, and religious services.
targetString: Weewale ebifo omuli abantu abangi, naddala ebizimbe ebitalina bulungi w’oyisiza mpewo, gamba ng’enkuŋŋaana, ebivvulu, ebifo by’obusuubuzi, entambula ey’olukale, n’enkuŋŋaana.

sourceString: Events which involve a large scale gathering of people, from religious pilgrimages to music concerts, are being canceled worldwide, in an effort to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Emikolo egirimu okukuŋŋaanya abantu abangi, nga mwe muli okulamaga n’ebivvulu by’ennyimba, byasazibwamu mu nsi yonna, mu kaweefube w’okutangira okusaasaana kw’akawuka.

sourceString: Tourist attractions, businesses, and transportation may be closed, especially in affected countries.
targetString: Ebisikiriza abalambuzi, bizinensi, n’eby’entambula biyinza okuggalwawo, naddala mu nsi ezikoseddwa.

sourceString: Some canceled events, especially performances, sporting events, and classes, are being moved online, which means you can experience them without traveling.
targetString: Emikolo egimu egisaziddwamu, naddala ebivvulu, eby’emizannyo n’okuyigirizibwa, biteereddwa ku mitimbagano, ekitegeeza nti osobola okubifuna awatali kutambula.

sourceString: At petrol/gas stations, use gloves or wipe down the handle with a disinfectant wipe if you can.
targetString: Ku masundiro g’amafuta/, kozesa giraavu oba simuula ku kikondo n’eddagala eritta obuwuka bw’oba osobola.

sourceString: After filling up, clean your hands with hand sanitizer.
targetString: Bw’omala okuteekamu amafuta, yonja engalo zo n’eddagala eritta obuwuka bw’omu ngalo.

sourceString: The U.S. and Canadian governments recommend avoiding travel by cruise ship.
targetString: Gavumenti za U.S. ne Canadian zisemba eky’okwewala okutambulira ku mmeeri.

sourceString: Infections spread easily on board, and medical care is limited.
targetString: Obulwadde busaasaana mangu mu kusaabala, ate nga eby’obujjanjabi bitono ddala.

sourceString: Amid a cruise ship outbreak, quarantines and docking are challenging partly due to the large number of people aboard.
targetString: Singa obulwadde bubalukawo ku mmeeri, kalantiini n’okugoba ku mwalo kizibuwala olw’ensonga nti abantu baba bangi ku mmeeri.

sourceString: Even cruise ships without confirmed cases have been denied permission to dock due to virus fears, and in the high-profile case of the Diamond Princess in Japan, hundreds of people were infected on the ship.
targetString: N’amaato agasaabaza abantu agatalinaako mulwadde yenna akakasiddwa gagaaniddwa okugoba ku myalo olw’okutya akawuka, ate ku nsonga y’eryato eriyitibwa Diamond Princess mu Japan, ebikumi n’ebikumi by’abantu byakosebwa ku mmeeri.

sourceString: If you believe you may be infected, call a hospital or local emergency medical services instead of going in person to avoid infecting others.
targetString: Bw’oba nga olowooza nti okwatiddwa obulwadde, kubira eddwaliro oba ab’ebyobulamu abakola ku bujjanjabi obw’amangu mu kitundu kyo essimu mu kifo ky’okwetwala ggwe okusobola okutangira okusiiga abalala.

sourceString: Mention your symptoms and travel history.
targetString: Yogera ku bubonero by’ofunye ne gy’obadde otambulira.

sourceString: Wear a medical mask and follow the instructions of authorities and doctors.
targetString: Yambala akakookolo era ogoberere ebiragiro ebikuweebwa ab’obuyinza n’abasawo.

sourceString: See also: Flight and health
targetString: Laba ne bino: Okulinnya ennyonyi n’ebyobulamu

sourceString: On a plane, follow the same hygiene practices as anywhere else: wash hands frequently, or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer if it's not convenient to leave your seat, and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Ku nnyonyi, gooberera amateeka g’eby’obuyonjo nga ewalala wonna: naaba mu ngalo buli kiseera, oba kozesa amazzi agalimu omwenge n’eddagala eritta obuwuka aganaabibwa mu ngalo (alcohol-based hand sanitizer) bwe kiba nga kikukaluubiriza okusituka w’otudde, era weewale okwekwata mu maaso.

sourceString: Researchers have found that passengers in window seats have less risk of contact with sick people.
targetString: Abanoonyereza bakizudde nti abasaabaze abatuula mu bifo eby’oku madirisa si kyangu nnyo kusemberera bantu balwadde.

sourceString: Try to book a window seat, and avoid moving around the cabin during the flight.
targetString: Fuba okufuna ekifo ky’oku ddirisa, era weewale okutambulatambula mu nnyonyi mu kiseera ky’olugendo.

sourceString: After washing your hands and before sitting down, use disinfectant wipes to wipe down the area around your seat.
targetString: Bw’omala okunaaba mu ngalo nga tonnaba kutuula, kozesa obusiimuula obutta obuwuka okusiimuula awo awaliraanye w’otuula.

sourceString: Wipe hard surfaces, and if your seat is leather you can wipe that too.
targetString: Siimuula kungulu w’ebintu ebikaluba, ate omusipi gwo bwe guba gwa ddiba nagwo osobola okugusiimuula.

sourceString: Don't wipe a cloth seat, as the moisture can make transmission easier.
targetString: Entebe bw’eba ya lugoye tosiimuulako, kubanga okunnyuukirira kusobola okwanguyizaako okusaasaanya obulwadde.

sourceString: When using disinfectant wipes, follow the instructions on the packaging.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’okozesa obusiimuula obutta obuwuka, goberera ebiragiro ebiri ku kisabika.

sourceString: And remember, viruses enter through your mouth, nose, and eyes – wiping down the area doesn't hurt, but it's not a substitute for proper hygiene.
targetString: Jjukira nti, obuwuka buyingirira mu kamwako, ennyindo, n’amaaso - okusiimuula mu bifo ekyo tekirina buzibu, naye ate tekisaanidde kukolebwa nga kyekwaso obutakuuma bya buyonjo ebisaanidde.

sourceString: Wash your hands and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Naaba mu ngalo era weewale okwekwata mu maaso.

sourceString: And use a tissue to touch the touch screen or other controls.
targetString: Era kozesa akapapula akagonvu akeesiimuzibwa ng’okwata ku sikuliini oba ekintu ekirala.

sourceString: When using the lavatory, use paper towels to turn off the faucet and open the door, then throw them away.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’okozesa kaabuyonjo, kozesa obutawulo obw’obupapula okunyoola omunyolo olwo ogulewo oluggi, oluvannyuma obutawulo obusuule.

sourceString: Airlines in affected areas are taking steps to reduce transmission and keep passengers safe.
targetString: Ennyonyi eziri mu bifo ebikoseddwa zikola ekisoboka okukendeeza okusaasaana n’okukuuma abasaabaze nga tebalina buzibu.

sourceString: For instance, these may include cleaning facilities more frequently, allowing flight attendants to wear masks, and serving prepackaged instead of freshly heated meals.
targetString: Okugeza, muno muyinza okubaamu okulongoosa ennyonyi buli kiseera, okukkiriza abakola ku nnyonyi okwambala obukookolo, n’okugaba eby’okulya ebyategekeddwa edda mu kifo ky’ebyo ebifumbiddwaawo.

sourceString: If a group of passengers is connecting from an area with a severe outbreak, the flight attendants may be able to seat them away from the rest of the passengers (and if you were recently in a high-risk area, consider telling the flight attendants for this reason).
targetString: Singa ekibinja ky’abasaabaze kiva mu kitundu ekirimu ennyo obulwadde, abakola ku nnyonyi basobola okubatuuza nga babaawudde ku basaabaze abalala (era singa emabegako waliko mu kifo ekirimu ennyo obulwadde, faayo otegeeze abakola mu nnyonyi olw’ensonga eno).

sourceString: You may be prohibited from changing seats on the flight.
targetString: Oyinza okugaanibwa okukyusa ebifo ku nnyonyi.

sourceString: This is so that, if someone on the flight turns out to be infected, the authorities can track down the people who were sitting near them for testing or quarantine.
targetString: Kino kiri bwe kityo olw’ensonga nti, singa omuntu omu ku nnyonyi kizuulibwa nti alina obulwadde, aboobuyinza basobola okulondoola abantu ababadde batudde okumuliraana basobole okukeberebwa oba okwawulwa.

sourceString: COVID-19 is treated by relieving symptoms and preventing complications.
targetString: COVID-19 ajjanjabibwa na kukkakkanya ku bubonero n’okutangira obulabe.

sourceString: There is no vaccine or specific treatment for the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Tewali ddagala ligema oba obujjanjabi obumanyiddwa obw’akawuka akabaluseewo aka corona.

sourceString: Research into a vaccine or specific antiviral drug is underway.
targetString: Okunoonyereza ku ddagala erigema oba eddagala erikalwanyisa kugenda mu maaso.

sourceString: There are a variety of trials using HIV medications and other novel antiviral medications for treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Waliwo okugezesebwa okwenjawulo okugenda mu maaso nga bakozesa eddagala ly’akawuka ka mukenenya n’eddagala eddala erirwanyisa ebirwadde ebibalukawo okusobola okujjanjaba ekirwadde kya COVID-19.

sourceString: Mild symptoms may be relieved by taking paracetamol (acetaminophen).
targetString: Obubonero obutonotono busobola okujjanjabibwa ng’omira paracetamol (acetaminophen).

sourceString: If you are infected with COVID-19, countries will isolate you until several consecutive tests for COVID-19 are negative.
targetString: Singa obeera n’obulwadde bwa COVID-19, ensi zijja kukwawula okutuusa ng’okebeddwa enfunda eziwera ne kizuulibwa nti tokyalina kirwadde kya COVID-19.

sourceString: If you have been in close contact with someone infected with COVID-19, many countries will quarantine you for 14 days since the last exposure and monitor you for signs and symptoms.
targetString: Singa obadde n’omuntu alina obulwadde bwa COVID-19, amawanga mangi gajja kukwawula okumala ennaku 14 okuva lwe wasemba okubeera n’omuntu omulwadde olwo bakwekenneenye okulaba oba olina obubonero obweyoleka.

sourceString: Some countries will also test you even if you don't have symptoms.
targetString: Ensi ezimu zijja kukukebera ne bw’onooba tolina bubonero bwonna.

sourceString: In many countries, the healthcare system has been stretched to the point of not being able to handle the sheer number of patients, and there is a chance you may be refused treatment due to the lack of available medical staff, supplies or equipment.
targetString: Mu nsi nnyingi, eby’obulamu bizitoowereddwa era nga tebakyasobola kujjanjaba muwendo gwa balwadde guyitiridde, era kisoboka okugaana okukuwa obujjanjabi olw’obutabaawo bajjanjabi, ebikozesebwa oba ebyuma.

sourceString: Many countries have shut down or severely limited flights, ships, and border crossings, especially to and from affected areas.
targetString: Ensi nnyingi ziggaliddewo eby’entambula y’ennyonyi oba zikkiriza ennyonyi ntono ddala, emmeeri, n’okusala ku nsalo, naddala okugenda n’okuva mu bitundu ebikoseddwa obulwadde.

sourceString: Even more countries have imposed restrictions on arriving travelers, either barring entry (maybe with an exception for local citizens and permanent residents) or requiring you to be quarantined, typically for 14 days.
targetString: N’amawanga mangi gatadde obukwakkulizo ku basaabaze abatuuka mu nsi zaabwe, nga bagaana abayingira mu nsi zaabwe (oboolyawo nga batalizaako bannansi baabwe oba abatuuze ab’enkalakkalira) oba okusooka okubaawula, okumala ennaku 14.

sourceString: Even if a mandatory quarantine is not imposed, you may be asked to "self-quarantine" by staying at home and not interacting with other people.
targetString: Ne bwe kiba nti okwawulibwa si kwa buwaze, osobola okusabibwa “okweyawula” nga osigala ewaka n’obuteetaba na bantu balala.

sourceString: The most severe restrictions are on travellers who have recently been to affected areas, but increasingly many countries are applying them to incoming travellers overall.
targetString: Obukwakkulizo obusinga okuba obw’amaanyi bwe bw’abasaabaze abava mu bitundu ebikoseddwa ennyo, naye nga ensi ezisinga kati ziteeka obukwakkulizo obwo ku basaabaze bonna abayingira amawanga gaabwe.

sourceString: Some countries have even prohibited all or almost all foreigners from entry or limited the ability of local citizens and residents to leave.
targetString: Ensi ezimu ziweredde ddala abagwirwa bonna oba abasinga obungi okuyingira mu nsi zaabwe oba bataddewo obukwakkulizo bungi ku kutambula kw’abatuuze baabwe okuvaamu okutambula.

sourceString: What are the affected areas?
targetString: Bitundu ki ebikoseddwa?

sourceString: Well, this is a fast-changing situation, and each country/region/organization has its own list of what areas are subject to restrictions.
targetString: Ekyamazima, embeera eno ekyukakyuka nnyo, era buli nsi/ddiini/kitongole birina olukala lw’ebyo bye bataddeko obukwakkulizo.

sourceString: The city of Wuhan is on every list and the rest of mainland China is on most.
targetString: Ekibuga kya Wuhan kiri ku buli lukalala era n’ebitundu bya China ebirala eby’olukalu nabyo biri ku nkalala ezisinga obungi.

sourceString: Other areas that are often included: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Schengen Area as a whole, and sometimes various others.
targetString: Ebitundu ebirala ebirabikira ennyo ku nkalala: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, United Kingdom, United States, ebitundu ebya Schengen byonna wamu, oluusi n’ebirala.

sourceString: Some countries have imposed restrictions based on citizenship or residency from severely affected areas.
targetString: Amawanga agamu gataddewo obukwakkulizo okusinziira ku butuuze oba omuntu gy’abeera naddala mu nsi ezikosedddwa ennyo ekirwadde.

sourceString: A detailed list of entry restrictions is maintained by the IATA.
targetString: Olukalala olulimu ebinnyonnyola ebikugira okuyingira mu mawanga luli ku IATA.

sourceString: It doesn't cover all the restrictions, but it's still useful.
targetString: Terulaga bikugirwa byonna, naye era lusigala nga lwa mugaso.

sourceString: Keep up to date—the outbreak and the travel restrictions are changing rapidly.
targetString: Weekumire mu kumanya—okubalukawo kw’ekirwadde n’obukwakkulizo ku by’entambula bikyukakyuka buli kiseera.

sourceString: For travel in the near future, consider making refundable reservations in case the changing situation forces you to change your plans.
targetString: Bw’oba wakutambula mu bbanga eritali lya wala, lowooza ku kwekwata ekifo ku nnyonyi naye ng’osobola okuddizibwa ssente zo singa embeera ekyukakyuka ekukaka okukyusa mu nteekateeka zo.

sourceString: Avoid buying tickets with a connection in an affected area – even changing planes can make you subject to restrictions.
targetString: Weewale okugula tikiti ng’ennyonyi eyitira mu kifo ekirimu obulwadde - kubanga n’okuva ku nnyonyi emu okudda ku ndala kisobola okukuviirako okukugirwa.

sourceString: Flights may get canceled with little notice, either due to the disease's spread and ever-changing entry restrictions, or simply because fewer people are flying and airlines are having trouble filling seats.
targetString: Entambula z’ennyonyi zisobola okusazibwamu n’okulabula mu bbanga ettono, olw’okusaasana kw’obulwadde n’obukwakkulizo obukyukakyuka buli kiseera, oba olw’okuba nti abantu batono ddala abatambula nga ennyonyi zikaluubirizibwa okujjuza ebifo.

sourceString: You might also be delayed for hours upon arrival waiting for temperature checks and related procedures and paperwork, or even get quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Osobola n’okulwisibwa okumala essaawa eziwerako nga otuuse nga olinda okuberebwa ebbugumu ly’omubiri gwo n’engeri endala ezeekuusa ku ekyo n’okukola ku mpapula, oba n’okwawulibwa okumala wiiki bbiri.

sourceString: Be prepared for the possibility of disruption to your travel plans, especially if traveling internationally.
targetString: Weetegekere obusobozi bw’okutaataagana mu nteekateeka z’eby’entambula yo, naddala singa oba otambula w’abweru wa ggwanga.

sourceString: Even if you're nowhere near affected areas there's a risk that you'll have to stay at the destination longer than planned if you've shared a building or vessel with an infected person.
targetString: Ne bw’oba nga toli kumpi na bifo bikoseddwa, waliwo obulabe nti oyinza okusigala gy’olaze ebbanga ddeneko okusinga bwe wateeseteese bw’oba ng’ogabanye ekizimbe oba emmeeri n’omuntu omulwadde.

sourceString: For example, in late February an Italian doctor on vacation in Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) was diagnosed with COVID-19, and as a result all the guests in the hotel he stayed at were quarantined.
targetString: Okugeza, ku nkomerero y’omwezi Gwokubiri omusawo Omuyitale eyali agenze okuwummulako mu Costa Adeje (mu bizinga bya Canary) yazuulibwamu ekirwadde kya COVID-19, era olwo abagenyi bonna abaali mu wooteli mwe yali abeera bonna ne baawulibwa.

sourceString: Lockdowns and other internal restrictions
targetString: Emiggalo n’ebikugira ebirala eby’omu ggwanga mu nda.

sourceString: Some countries and regions, especially severely affected ones, are implementing emergency lockdowns and restrictions on people's movements and activities, even for those who haven't recently been abroad.
targetString: Ensi ezimu n’ebitundu, naddala ebyo ebikoseddwa ennyo, bitaddewo emiggalo egy’akagwirawo n’okukugira entambula y’abantu n’emirimu, ne ku bantu abatabadde bweru wa ggwanga.

sourceString: These include the temporary reintroduction of some border controls, restrictions on travel within the country, closing or limiting service at restaurants and other establishments, banning large public events, and in the most severe cases prohibiting people from leaving the house except for essential reasons.
targetString: Muno mulimu okuzzaawo okukugira ku nsalo okw’ekiseera, okukugira entambula y’abantu munda mu ggwanga, okuggalawo oba okuteeka obukwakkulizo ku birabo by’emmere n’ebifo ebirala, okuwera emikolo egy’olukale egy’abantu abangi, ne mu mbeera embi ennyo okuziyiza abantu okuva mu mayumba gaabwe okuggyako nga waliwo ensonga ey’amaanyi ddala.

sourceString: Beyond government restrictions, individual establishments are shutting their doors and cancelling events to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ng’oggyeeko obukwakkulizo bwa gavumenti, abantu ssekinnoomu beggaliddeyo mu mayumba gaabwe n’okusazaamu emikolo okugezaako okukendeeza ku kusaasaana kw’akawuka.

sourceString: In China, there are extensive restrictions on transportation and activity, which vary widely by province, city, and even by district or village.
targetString: Mu China, waliwo obukwakkulizo bungi nnyo ku by’entambula n’emirimu, nga bino byawukana mu buli ssaza, ekibuga, wamu ne disitulikiti oba ekyalo.

sourceString: Many governments recommend against traveling to China at this time.
targetString: Gavumenti nnyingi zirabula abantu obutagenda China mu kiseera kino.

sourceString: If you have no choice, do your research and get up-to-date information about the local situation wherever you are going.
targetString: Bw’oba tolina kya kukola, kola okunoonyereza kwo ofune obubaka obutuufu ku mbeera eriwo mu kitundu gy’ogenda.

sourceString: People who have traveled to Hubei face particularly severe restrictions.
targetString: Abantu abagenze e Hubei babateekako obukwakkulizo bungi.

sourceString: Examples of restrictions that you may encounter in some parts of China (this is not an exhaustive list):
targetString: Eby’okulabirako by’obukwakkulizo bw’oyinza okuteekebwako mu bitundu ebimu eby’omu China (olukalala luno si lwa nkomeredde):

sourceString: 14-day quarantine, self-quarantine, or COVID-19 test upon arrival from other parts of China or from other countries, at your expense
targetString: okwawulibwa okumala ennaku 14, okweyawula wekka, oba okukeberebwa obulwadde bwa COVID-19 nga otuuse okuva mu bitundu bya China ebirala oba okuva mu nsi endala, nga ggwe weesasulira

sourceString: questions about your travel and medical history (lying can get you years in prison)
targetString: ebibuuzo ebikwata ku ntambula zo n’ebyafaayo by’obulamu bwo (okulimba kuyinza okukuviirako okusibwa emyaka mu kkomera)

sourceString: mandatory registration using an online or paper form
targetString: okwewandiisa okw’obuwaze ng’okozesa omutimbagano oba okujjuzaamu ffoomu y’olupapula

sourceString: requirement to wear a face mask in public
targetString: nga kikwetaagisa okwambala akakookolo ng’oli mu bantu

sourceString: people who have been outside of China within 14 days not allowed into public places like malls
targetString: abantu ababadde ebweru wa China mu nnaku 14 tebakkirizibwa mu bifo bya lukale ng’ebizimbe ebinene

sourceString: shops only accept mobile payments, not cash
targetString: amaduuka gakkiriza kusasulwa kwa ku ssimu, si kubawa ssente mu mpeke

sourceString: restaurants, transportation and other establishments refusing service to non-Chinese citizens
targetString: ebirabo by’emmere, eby’entambula n’ebintu ebirala okugaana okuweereza abatali bannansi ba China

sourceString: many forms of transportation reduced or shut down
targetString: enkola z’eby’entambula nnyingi zikendeezeddwa oba okuggalwawo

sourceString: mandatory real-name registration for public transit cards
targetString: okwewandiisa n’amannya go gennyini okusobola okufuna kkaadi ekutambuza okugenda mu ggwanga eddwala

sourceString: access in and out of a town, village, or city completely blocked
targetString: obutakkirizibwa kuyingira oba kufuluma kabuga akamu, ekyalo, oba ekibuga

sourceString: non-resident visitors prohibited from entering apartment complexes
targetString: abagenyi abatasula ku bizimbe obutakkirizibwa kubiyingiramu

sourceString: only allowed to go outside once every two days to get supplies
targetString: okukkirizibwa okufuluma ebweru omulundi gumu gwokka buli nnaku bbiri okugula ebyetaago

sourceString: businesses, activities, and attractions closed
targetString: bizinensi, emirimu, n’ebisikiriza okuggalwawo

sourceString: businesses need local government permission to re-open
targetString: bizinensi zeetaga olukusa lwa gavumenti y’ekitundu okuddamu okuggulawo

sourceString: restaurants (if they are even open) require a minimum distance between customers
targetString: ebirabo by’emmere (bwe biba nga biguddewo) byetaagibwa okulekawo amabanga amagere wakati wa ba kasitooma

sourceString: selling substandard face masks has a maximum sentence of life imprisonment
targetString: okutunda obukookolo obutatuukana na mutindo kikusibya ebbanga ery’obulamu bwo bwonna

sourceString: As of mid-March 2020, Europe is the epicenter of the epidemic, and many European countries have closed their borders to international travel - only border commuters and freight are allowed to cross.
targetString: We bwatuukira mu makkati g’omwezi Gw’okusatu 2020, Bulaaya y’asingamu ekirwadde, era ensi nnyingi ez’omu Bulaaya ziggaddewo ensalo zaazo eri abatambula okufuluma n’okuyingira mu mawanga gaabwe - abo bokka abasala ensalo ku bigere n’abatambuza eby’amaguzi be bakkirizibwa okusala.

sourceString: Also businesses other than food stores and pharmacies are closed, and public transport has been reduced or stopped.
targetString: Era bizinensi ng’oggyeeko ezitunda emmere n’amaduuka g’eddagala nzigale, era n’entambula ey’olukale yakeendeezebwa oba yayimirizibwa.

sourceString: In the worst affected countries including Italy, Spain and France, lockdowns like in China in January, have been implemented.
targetString: Mu nsi ezisinze okukosebwa omuli Italy, Spain ne France, okuggalawo buli kimu nga bwe kyali e China mu mwezi gwa Janwali kye kikoleddwa.

sourceString: As well the EU has closed its outer borders.
targetString: Era n’omukago gwa Bulaaya guggadde ensalo zaagwo ez’ebweru.

sourceString: COVID-19 is prevalent also in North America.
targetString: COVID-19 ali ne mu North America.

sourceString: The borders between Canada, the U.S., and Mexico are closed to non-essential travel, and in many areas bans on big gatherings are in effect (this means places like restaurants are closed, and events are canceled).
targetString: Ensalo wakati wa Canada, U.S., ne Mexico nzigale ku kutambula okutali kwa nsonga, era ne mu bitundu bingi enkuŋŋaana ez’abantu abangi zaawerebwa (kino kitegeeza nti ebifo nga ebirabo by’emmere biggale era n’emikolo gyasazibwamu.

sourceString: Numerous state, county, and municipal jurisdictions have issued stay-at-home orders that require all nonessential businesses to close.
targetString: Amawanga ag’enjawulo, amasaza, ne munisipaali biyisizza ebiragiro by’okusigala ewaka ebyetaagisa buli bizinensi ezitali za nkizo nnyo okuggalawo

sourceString: With lots of flights canceled, warnings issued, and restrictions imposed, flying in the time of coronavirus can be a challenge.
targetString: Olw’okusazibwamu kw’entambula y’ennyonyi ezisinga, okuwa okulabula, n’okuteekawo obukwakkulizo, okutambula mu biseera by’akawuka ka corona kisobola okubaamu okusoomooza.

sourceString: Some routes are not possible.
targetString: Amakubo agamu tegasoboka kuyitibwamu.

sourceString: Others will require more inconvenient connections than usual—multiple stops and long waits between flights.
targetString: Amalala gajja kwetaagisa okuyitira mu bifo awakaluubiriza okusinga bulijjo - omuli okuyimirira enfunda eziwera n’okulindira ebbanga eddene okuddamu okulinnya ennyonyi endala ekwongerayo.

sourceString: In some cases that means more expensive tickets.
targetString: Oluusi ekyo kiyinza okutegeeza okugula tikiti ku buseere okusinga bulijjo.

sourceString: On the other hand, the good news is that many flights are cheaper than usual due to decreased demand, and there's a decent chance you'll get an empty seat next to you.
targetString: Wabula ate, amawulire amalungi gali nti ennyonyi ezisinga za ssente ntonoko okusinga bulijjo olw’abazikozesa okukendeera, era waliwo omukisa munene nti ekifo ekikuliraanye kijja kuba kyereere.

sourceString: Build in extra time for your connections, especially if transferring from an international flight to a domestic flight and especially if your itinerary involves a country that's seriously affected.
targetString: Yongeramu obudde bw’onoomala nga ova ku nnyonyi emu okudda ku ndala, naddala singa onooba ng’ova ku nnyonyi ey’omu nsi endala okudda ku y’omu nsi mwoli naddala singa entambula yo erimu okuyitira mu nsi ekoseddwa ennyo ekirwadde.

sourceString: Screenings, temperature checks, extra paperwork, and the associated waiting around can add minutes or hours before you're allowed to continue on your journey.
targetString: Okwekebejjebwa, okukebera ebbugumu ly’omubiri, okujjuza empapula okweyongeramu, n’ebyekuusa ku kulinda bisobola okwongeramu eddakiika oba essaawa eziwera nga tonnakkirizibwa kweyongerayo ku lugendo lwo.

sourceString: You may find it harder than usual to buy a ticket to or from a destination subject to warnings and restrictions.
targetString: Oyinza okukaluubirizibwamu okusinga bulijjo ng’ogula tikiti okugenda oba okuva mu kifo ekirimu okulabula n’obukwakkulizo.

sourceString: This is a real concern if you're trying to get out of an affected area.
targetString: Kino kifiibwako nnyo singa oba ogezaako okufuluma ekitundu ekikoseddwa.

sourceString: For instance, most aggregators are not selling tickets from China to the United States (presumably to avoid falling afoul of restrictions and being on the hook for a passenger's flight out).
targetString: Okugeza, bakayungirizi abasinga tebakyatunda tikiti eziva e China okudda mu United States (kirowoozebwa nti beewala kugwa mu buzibu bw’obukwakkulizo n’okubeera ku bunkenke okulaba ng’ennyonyi y’omusaabaze etambula).

sourceString: To buy a ticket for an itinerary like this, you may have to contact the airline or use a lesser-known aggregator.
targetString: Okugula tikiti ey’entambula bw’eti, kyandikwetaagisa okuwuliziganya ne kkampuni y’ennyonyi oba okukozesa kayungirizi atamanyiddwa nnyo.

sourceString: Another possibility is to buy two separate tickets (for instance, a ticket from China to Cambodia and a second ticket from Cambodia to the U.S.), but be careful you won't get quarantined or lose your luggage in between.
targetString: Engeri endala ye y’okugula tikiti bbiri ez’enjawulo (okugeza, etikiti ekuggya e China okukutwala e Cambodia ne tikiti endala okuva e Cambodia okugenda mu U.S.), naye weegendereze obutakukwatirayo oba okubulwako omugugu gwo wakati awo.

sourceString: Connecting flights can be a problem.
targetString: Ennyonyi ezikuleka mu kifo ekimu okulinnya endala oluusi ziba nzibuzibu.

sourceString: The risk of getting stuck in the connection city is higher than usual right now, due to delays for screening and testing as well as extensive cancellations.
targetString: Obuzibu bw’okulemwa okuva mu kibuga gy’oyitidde okulinnya ennyonyi endala buli waggulu nnyo mu kiseera kino okusinga bulijjo, olw’okulwisibwa nga mwekebejjebwa n’okukeberebwa n’okusazaamu ennyonyi okucaase ennyo.

sourceString: Connecting in an affected area may lead to entry restrictions later on, and if you've been in an affected area recently some countries won't even let you change planes.
targetString: Okuyitira mu kifo ekirimu obulwadde kiyinza okukuviirako okugaanibwa okuyingira gy’ogenda mu maaso eyo, ate bw’oba nga obaddeko mu kifo ekirimu obulwadde emabegako katono ensi ezimu tezijja wadde kukukkiriza kukyusa nnyonyi.

sourceString: On certain itineraries there is a risk of getting quarantined somewhere along the way.
targetString: Mu kutambula okumu waliwo obusobozi bw’okukukwatira mu kkubo.

sourceString: So book a direct flight if you can, and if not, think carefully about where to connect.
targetString: Noolwekyo gula tikiti ya nnyonyi ekutwala obutereevu, ate bw’oba tosobodde, lowooza nnyo ku wa gy’ogenda okuyitira.

sourceString: In uncertain times, plans can change.
targetString: Mu biseera eby’okusoberwa, enteekateeka zisobola okukyuka

sourceString: Many embassies and consulates have evacuated nonessential staff, and some have shut down operations completely.
targetString: Ebitebe by’amawanga amalala ne woofiisi z’amawanga amalala baggyeewo abakozi abatali ba nkizo nnyo, era n’abamu baggaliddewo ddala emirimu.

sourceString: Emergency assistance should still be available, though it's possible you may have to contact a further-away consulate if your local one has shut down.
targetString: Wateekwa okusigalawo okuyambibwa okw’amangu, naye ng’oluusi oyinza okuwuliza ekitebe ky’eggwanga lyo ekiri ewalako singa ekikuli okumpi kiba kiggaddewo.

sourceString: If you have been stranded due to the pandemic, your nearest consulate may be able to help you find a flight home, arrange an emergency loan so you can buy a ticket, or provide an emergency passport.
targetString: Bw’oba ng’olemereddwa okuva mu nsi olw’ekirwadde, ekitebe ky’eggwanga lyo ekikuli okumpi basobola okukuyamba okukufunira ennyonyi ekuzza eka, okukufunira ssente ez’amangu osobole okugula tikiti, oba okukufunira paasipooti ey’amangu.

sourceString: At the very least they can keep you informed about the local situation and notify you about recently introduced travel requirements and restrictions.
targetString: Waakiri basobola okukuwanga amawulire agakwata ku mbeera eriwo mu kitundu n’okukutegeeza ku byetaagisa n’obukwakkulizo obupya ebiteereddwawo mu kutambula.

sourceString: Ordinary consular services such as visa and passport processing may be suspended or restricted to urgent need, depending on the location and the consulate.
targetString: Empeereza y’ekitebe ky’eggwanga eza bulijjo gamba nga okukola ku bya visa ne paasipooti byandiyimirizibwa oba okubiwa abo bokka abalina obwetaavu obw’amangu, okusinziira ku kitundu ekitebe we kiri.

sourceString: Although some people call the disease "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Wuhan disease", or "Chinese virus", the use of these terms is considered racist in China and by many people of Chinese origin.
targetString: Newankubadde abantu abamu obulwadde babuyita “lubyamira we Wuhan” (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "bulwadde bwe Wuhan", oba "akawuka k’Abachina", enkozesa y’ebigambo bino Abachina bangi bagitwala okubaamu obusosoze.

sourceString: It is still common to refer the disease as "Wuhan pneumonia" or "Chinese virus" in places like Hong Kong and Taiwan.
targetString: Kya bulijjo obulwadde buno okubwogerako nga "lubyamira we Wuhan" oba "akawuka k’Abachina" mu bitundu nga Hong Kong ne Taiwan.

sourceString: To be safe, use location-neutral terms when referring to the disease, such as "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", or just "the virus" or "the pandemic".
targetString: Obutaleeta buzibu, kozesa ebigambo ebiteekuusa ku kitundu bw’oba ng’oyogera ku bulwadde buno, gamba nga "COVID-19", "akawuka akatamanyiddwa aka corona", oba gamba bugambi nti "akawuka" oba "nnawookeera".

sourceString: Particularly in developing countries where law enforcement are poorly trained, enforcement of curfew, lockdown or stay-at-home orders are often brutal, often using forces not proportionate against crowds.
targetString: Naddala mu nsi ezikyakula awali abakwasisa amateeka abatali batendeke bulungi, bakozesa obukambwe bungi, ebiseera ebisinga bakozesa eryanyi eriteetaagisa ku bantu, nga bagenderera okussa mu nkola ebiragiro ebikugira abantu okutambula mu ssaawa eziba ziragiddwa, omuggalo, n’abantu okusigala ewaka.

sourceString: Comply with these orders, and avoid crowds in public.
targetString: Gondera ebiragiro bino, era weewale ebifo ebirimu abantu abangi.

sourceString: As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, xenophobia has risen in many countries, primarily but not exclusively targeting people perceived to be Chinese.
targetString: Olw’okubalukawo kw’ekirwadde ekireetebwa akawuka ka corona, obukyali mu nsi nnyingi bweyongedde, okusinga eri abantu abalowoozebwa okuba Abachina weewaawo n’abalala.

sourceString: There has been a worldwide spike in racist incidents targeting people of East Asian origin, including in major cities such as New York, London and San Francisco.
targetString: Okusosola kweyongedde mu nsi yonna eri abantu abasibuka mu bitundu bya Asia Eby’obuvanjuba, naddala mu bibuga nga New York, London ne San Francisco.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, Sinophobia, which was already high to begin with, has intensified as a result of the pandemic, with the result that many shops and restaurants are now denying service to mainland Chinese customers and banning Mandarin speakers from their premises (with the exception of Taiwanese).
targetString: Mu Hong Kong, obukyayi eri Abachina, obwasangiddwa nga buli waggulu ddala, bweyongedde oluvannyuma lw’okubalukawo kwa nnawookeera, ekireeseewo amaduuka mangi n’ebirabo by’emmere okugaana okuweereza Abachina abaviira ddala mu China wamu n’okuwera aboogezi b’olulimi Olumandarin ku bizimbe byabwe (okuggyako Abataiwani bokka).

sourceString: Levels of xenophobia have also risen in East Asia, with some restaurants and other businesses in Japan and China refusing service to foreign customers.
targetString: Okusosola kweyongedde mu bitundu by’obuvanjuba bwa Asia, nga ebirabo by’emmere ebimu ne bizinensi endala mu Japan ne China zigaana okuweereza ba kasitooma abagwira.

sourceString: In China, there have been incidents of foreigners being refused rooms by hotel staff, and foreign residents, particularly black people, being kicked out of their apartments on short notice by their landlords.
targetString: Mu China, oluusi abakozi b’omu wooteeri babadde bagaana okuwa abagwira ebisenge eby’okusulamu, wamu n’abatuuze abatali bannansi, naddala abaddugavu, nga bannannyini mayumba ge bapangisa babagobamu nga tebeetegese.

sourceString: Sources for further information on the coronavirus outbreak include:
targetString: Obubaka obusingako ku bikwata ku kubalukawo kw’akawuka ka corona mulimu:

sourceString: The US government Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
targetString: Ebifo bya gavumenti ya US ebirwanyisa endwadde n’okuzitangira (The US government Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)

sourceString: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (daily updates)
targetString: Ekifo kya Bulaaya ekya European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (amawulire aga buli lunaku)

sourceString: United Kingdom government, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers
targetString: Gavumenti ya Bungereza, - Woofiisi y’Amawanga amalala ne woofiisi y’amawanga agaaliko amatwale ga Bungereza eruŋŋamya abatambuze (United Kingdom government, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers)

sourceString: An online map and dashboard from the John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering with live updates
targetString: Maapu y’okumutimbagano n’endagiriro okuva mu Ssettendekero lya John Hopkins erya Center for Systems Science and Engineering kwe baweera amawulire agaakagwawo

sourceString: Partial lists of entry restrictions from IATA and The New York Times
targetString: Olukalala olw’ekitundu olw’obukwakkulizo bw’okuyingira amawanga okuva mu IATA ne The New York Times

sourceString: A variety of misinformation and conspiracy theories about the virus are being promoted online and even by some government officials, so be careful which sources you check for information.
targetString: Amawulire mangi agatali matuufu n’okuwubisibwa kungi ku byekuusa ku kawuka biyitira ku mutimbagano, n’ebirala byogerwa abakungu ba gavumenti abamu, noolwekyo beera mwegendereza wa w’okeberera obubaka obukwata ku kawuka.

sourceString: Ensure that all information and advice you receive has been backed by reputable doctors and scientists.
targetString: Kakasa nti obubaka n’okuwabulwa kwonna kw’ofuna kukakasiddwa abasawo abakugu ne bannasaayansi.

sourceString: In a crisis, it's natural to want to keep following the latest updates, but it may be better for your mental health to moderate the amount of news that you look at, and stick to reliable news sources.
targetString: Mu kiseera eky’akazigizigi, kya butonde okwagala okugoberera amawulire agaliwo, naye kyandibadde kisingako ku lw’obulungi bw’endowooza yo okukendeeza ku mawulire g’ofuna, n’osigala ku mikutu egiwa amawulire ageesigika.

sourceString: If you normally watch the news twice per day then stick to this schedule and do something else, rather than having the 24-hour news on continuously.
targetString: Bw’oba nga otera okulaba amawulire emirundi ebiri mu lunaku sigala ku ntegeka eyo era obeeko n’ekirala ky’okola, mu kifo ky’okumala essaawa 24 nga oli ku mawulire.

sourceString: b'Bat SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), also sometimes called SARS-like coronavirus WIV1, is a strain of Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) isolated from Chinese rufous horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus sinicus).
targetString: b'Bat SARS-nga akawuka ka coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), oluusi akayitibwa SARS-like coronavirus WIV1, kaleeta obuzibu obw’amaanyi mu kussa-ekyekuusa ku kawuka ka coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) akava ku buwundo bw’Abachine obumanyiddwa nga Chinese rufous horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus sinicus).

sourceString: Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
targetString: Ng’obuwuka bwonna bu coronavirus, obubondo bulimu akaguwa kamu akalina positive-sense RNA ng’esabikiddwa okugyetoloola.

sourceString: The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Ebizuuliddwa bikakasa nti obuwundo bwe busangibwamu/butereka SARS-COV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
targetString: Okwekaliriza kw’enfuukafuuka y’ebitonde kulaga obusobozi bw’okusaasaanya SARS obutereevu okuva mu buwundo okudda mu bantu awatali kusooka kuyungirira na mafumbe g’e China nga bwe kyalowoozebwa mu kusooka.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: okuvumbula eddagala lya b'COVID-19 kwe kunoonyereza okukola eddagala erigema oba erijjanjaba erinaayamba okukkakkanya ku bulabe bw’obulwadde obuleetebwa akawuka ka 2019-20 coronavirus (COVID-19).

sourceString: The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.
targetString: International Clinical Trials Registry Platform eya WHO yawandiika okunoonyereza 536 okugenderera okukola eddagala erinajjanjaba abawonye COVID-19, wamu neddagala erikolebwa okuzimba obutaffaali bw’omubiri okusobola okujjanjaba obulwadde obulala obuli mu kunoonyerezebwako okuddamu okutunuulirwa.

sourceString: In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu, ekitongole kya WHO kyatandikawo "Okugezesa OKWAWAMU" mu mawanga 10, nga liwandiika enkumi z’abantu abaalina ekirwadde kya COVID-19 okulaba butya bwe bakoseddwa obujjanjabi bw’ebirungo bina ebirwanyisa obuwuka n’essuubi eddene nti linaakola.

sourceString: A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.
targetString: Okwekenneenya okw’omuzinzi, era okulambulukufu kwateekebwawo mu April 2020 okulondoola ekituukiddwako mu kugezesa okw’ekisawo okw’eddagala erigema n’okujjanjaba COVID-19 ku bantu abagezeserezebwako. Okukola eddagala erigema kuyita mu mitendera egy’enjawulo, nga kyetaaga emyaka egisoba mu etaano okukakasa ebirungo ebikoleddwa si bya bulabe era bituufu.

sourceString: Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
targetString: Okukola eddala gwe mutendera gw’okuleeta eddagala erigema oba okujjanjaba obulwadde obupya ne liteekebwa ku katale oluvannyuma lw’okuzuula ebirungo ebikulu okuyita mu kuvumbula eddagala.

sourceString: It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.
targetString: Muzingiramu okukola okunoonyereza mu ggezeserezo ku buwuka obusirikitu n’ebisolo, okusaba olukusa, okugeza okuyita mu FDA, okufuna olukusa okugezeseza ku bantu eddagala eppya erinoonyerezebwako, era kiyinza okwetaagisa okufuna olukusa okuteeka eddagala empya ku katale.

sourceString: Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
targetString: Okukola eddagala oba okujjanjaba COVID-19 kutandika na kugatta kirungo ekirowoozeddwako ku ddagala erisuubirwa okubaamu ebirungo ebigema eby’okukozesebwa mu kukola eddagala erigema oba erirwanyisa obuwuka eriri mu kugezesebwa.

sourceString: New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
targetString: New chemical entities (NCEs, era ezimanyiddwa nga new molecular entities or NMEs) birungo ebiva mu kuvumbula eddagala okusinziira ku muntu anagezeserezebwako okugema oba okujjanjaba.

sourceString: These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
targetString: Bino biwa essuubi mu kulwanyisa obuwuka obuba bulwanyisibwa nga bwekuusa ku kirwadde kya COVID-19

sourceString: At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
targetString: Ku ntandikwa y’okukola eddagala erigema oba erijjanjaba, wabaawo kitono ekimanyiddwa ku NCE ku bikwatagana n’obulabe, obutwa, entabula n’enkola yaalyo mu mubiri eri abantu At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.

sourceString: It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
targetString: Mulimu era buvunaanyizibwa bw’abakola eddagala okwekenneenya ebintu bino byonna nga tebannaligezesereza ku bantu okukakasa nti si lya bulabe ate ttuufu.

sourceString: A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).
targetString: Ekiruubirirwa ekirala ekikulu eky’okukola eddagala kwe kuwabula ku doozi n’okutegeka okugezesa obujjanjabi obusooka mu bantu (“okusooka-mu-bantu” [FIH] oba “Doozi esooka mu Bantu” [FHD], eyali emanyiddwa nga “first-in-man” [FIM]).

sourceString: In addition, drug development must establish the physicochemical properties of the NCE: its chemical makeup, stability, and solubility.
targetString: Ekirala, mu kukola eddagala olina okulaga ebirungo bya saayansi ebya NCE: birungo ki ebirimu, obuwangaazi bwalyo, n’obusobozi bw’okumulunguka.

sourceString: Manufacturers must optimize the process they use to make the chemical so they can scale up from a medicinal chemist producing milligrams, to manufacturing on the kilogram and ton scale.
targetString: Abafulumya eddagala bateekwa okukuuma omutindo gwe bakozesa nga bakola ebirungo basobole okwongeza ku bungi bw’eddagala erikolebwa omutabuzi waalyo afulumya milligulaamu, bafulumye mu bipimo bya kilogulaamu ne ttani.

sourceString: They further examine the product for suitability to package as capsules, tablets, aerosol, intramuscular injectable, subcutaneous injectable, or intravenous formulations.
targetString: Bagenda mu maaso ne beekenneenya ekikoleddwa okulaba kye balikolamu okugeza okusalawo oba bakola kapisulo, mpeke, lya kufuuyira, lya kukuba mu nnyama, lya kuyisa wansi wa lususu, oba likubibwa mu misuwa.
