sourceString: Together, these processes are known in preclinical and clinical development as chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC).Many aspects of drug development focus on satisfying the regulatory requirements of drug licensing authorities.
targetString: Gyonna wamu, emitendera gino egy’okunoonyereza ku ndwadde n’okuzuula obujjanjaba gimanyiddwa nga okutabula eddagala (chemistry), okufulumya eddagala, n’okulifuga (CMC). ebintu bingi ebyekuusa ku kufulumya eddagala bifaayo ku kutuukiriza emisoso gy’abalondoola eby’eddagala n’ebitongole ebiwa olukusa okulifulumya.

sourceString: These generally constitute tests designed to determine the major toxicities of a novel compound prior to first use in humans.
targetString: Muno muzingiramu okugezesa okukolebwa okuzuula obukambwe bw’ebirungo ebipya nga terinnakozesebwa mu bantu.

sourceString: The Canadian government announced CA$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian universities, with plans to establish a "vaccine bank" of new vaccines for implementation if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Gavumenti ya Canada yalangirira million CA$275 okusakiririra puloojekiti 96 z’eby’okunoonyereza ebyekuusa ku bujjanjabi obulwanyisa COVID-19, nga mwe muli n’abantu ab’enjawulo ab’okugezeserezaako eddagala erigema mu ssettendekero za Canada, n’enteekateeka okutandikawo “etterekero ly’eddagala erigema” ery’eddagala erigema eppya ery’okukozesa singa wabaawo okubalukawo kw’akawuka ka coronavirus okulala.

sourceString: Clinical trial programs involve three, multiple-year stages toward product approval, and a fourth, post-approval stage for ongoing safety monitoring of the vaccine or drug therapy:
targetString: Pulogulaamu z’okugezesa okw’ekisawo zirimu emitendera esatu, egy’okumala emyaka egiwerako ng’ekivaamu tekinnakkirizibwa, n’ogw’okuna, nga limaze okukakasibwa olwo ne lyekeneenyezebwa okulaba oba nga erigema n’erijjanjaba teririna bulabe:

sourceString: Phase I trials, usually in healthy volunteers, determine safety and dosing.
targetString: Okunoonyereza kw’omutendera I ogw’okugezesa, naddala ku beewaddeyo okugezeserezebwako naye nga si balwadde, gukakasa obutaba na bulabe n’ebipimo ebiweebwa.

sourceString: Phase II trials are used to establish an initial reading of efficacy and further explore safety in small numbers of people having the disease targeted by the NCE.
targetString: Okunoonyereza kw’Omutendera II gukozesebwa okukebera n’okukakasa obutuufu bw’ebyasooka okukolebwa n’okwongera okwekennenya oba tewali bulabe mu bantu abatono abalina obulwadde naye nga balondoolwa NCE.

sourceString: Phase III trials are large, pivotal trials to determine safety and efficacy in sufficiently large numbers of people with the COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Okugezesa kw’omutendera III kuba kugazi, kubaamu okugezesa okw’enkizo ennyo okukakasa oba tewali bulabe n’obutuufu bw’eddagala erigezeserezebwa ku bantu abawerera ddala abalina ekirwadde kya COVID-19.

sourceString: If safety and efficacy are adequately proved, clinical testing may stop at this step and the NCE advances to the new drug application (NDA) stage to begin marketing.
targetString: Singa kikakasibwa nti tewali bulabe oba nti eddagala ttuufu, okugezesa okw’ekisawo kuyinza okukomezebwa ku mutendera guno awo NCE n’egenda mu maaso okukozesa eddagala eppya (NDA) n’etandika okulitunda.

sourceString: Phase IV trials are post-approval trials that may be a condition attached by the FDA, also called post-market surveillance studies.
targetString: Okugezesa kw’omutendera IV kukolebwa oluvannyuma lw’okutongoza eddagala era liteekebwako obukwakkulizo bwa FDA, obuyitibwa okulondoola oluvannyuma lw’okuteeka ku katale.

sourceString: In addition to the tests required to move a novel vaccine or antiviral drug into the clinic for the first time, manufacturers must ensure that any long-term or chronic toxicities are well-defined, including effects on systems not previously monitored (fertility, reproduction, immune system, among others).
targetString: Ng’oggyeeko okugezesa okwetaagisa okuggya eddagala eppya erigema n’erirwanyisa obuwuga okutandika okulikozesa okujjanjaba omulundi ogusooka, abaIifulumya bateekwa okukakasa nti obutwa obumala ebbanga eddene oba obw’olubeerera bunnnyonnyolwa bulungi, nga mw’otwalidde n’obulabe bwalyo ku bintu ebirala ebitaalondoolwa bulungi (obusobozi bw’okuzaala, okuzaala, obusobozi bw’okulwanyisa endwadde n’ebirala).

sourceString: In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
targetString: Mu United States, enkola eno eyitibwa “new drug application” oba NDA.

sourceString: A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
targetString: Enteekateeka y’okugezesa kw’ekisawo nga kugenda mu maaso kusobola okulongoosebwamu nga “esobola okukyusibwakyusibwa” singa okukuŋŋaanya obubaka mu kugezesa kuwa okutangaaza okw’amangu ku birungi oba ebibi ku butuufu bw’obujjanjabi.

sourceString: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
targetString: Okugezesa kwa global Solidarity ne European Discovery ku bantu abaweereddwa ebitanda nga bayi n’ekirwadde kya COVID-19 bakozesa enkola esobola okukyusibwakyusibwamu okusobola okukyusakyusa amangu ebigobererwa mu kugezesa ng’ebivudde mu mitendera ena egy’okugezesa obujjanjabi bwe bifulumizibwa.

sourceString: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
targetString: Enteekateeka ezimanyiirwa mu kunoonyereza okw’Emitendera II-III okw’ekisawo mu kujjanjaba abalwadde kuyinza okuyimpaya ebbanga lyobujjanjabi n’okukozesa abalwadde abatonoko oboolyawo n’okwwanguya okusalawo okw’okukubasibuula amangu oba okuwangula wamu n’okukwanaganya enkyukakyuka z’enteekateka ez’obujjanjabi obugezesebwa mu bifo by’ensi yonna.

sourceString: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
targetString: Eddagala erisinga eribadde terimanyidwa (NCEs) ligaana mu kiseera ky’okulikulaakulanya, nga lirimu obutwa obutakkirizibwa oba nga lirabika terikola bulungi ku bulwadde obuluubirirwa, nga bwe kiragibwa mu Kunoonyereza kw’ekisawo okw’emitendera II-III.

sourceString: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
targetString: Okulemererwa okw’amaanyi okwekwanya ku nkulaakulanya y’eddagala kuyitibwa "okulemererwa okw’amaanyi", nga kwetaaga okusalawo mu mitendera egisooka mu kukulaakulanya eddagala “okutta” okunoonyereza nga bukyali olw’okwewala okufiirwa okulimu ssente ennyingi.

sourceString: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
targetString: Okunoonhyereza okumu okw’omu 2010 kwekaliriza ssente eziteekebwamu n’ezo eziteekebwamu okuva ewalala okultuusa ng’eddagala lituuse ku katale nga zenkanankana kumpi biliyoni za US$1.8 ne biliyoni $870ng’emiwendo egyo bwe giddiriŋŋana.

sourceString: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
targetString: Omuwendo omukkati oguteeberezebwa mu kugezesa kwa 2015-16 ogw’okukulaakulanya eddagala 10 erirwanyisa kookolo kwali miliyoni $648.

sourceString: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
targetString: Mu kwekaliriza okwa 2016 okw’eddagala lya mirundi 106 kwekenneenya okugezesa okw’ekisawo omuwendo gw’entandikwa mu nsaasaanya eri omukozi w’eddagala okutuusa eddagala lwe liyisibwa n’obuwanguzi mu Mutendera gw’okugezesa III nga guli biliyoni $2.6 (mu doola eya 2013), ate ng’omuwendo ogwo gweyongera buli mwaka ku kigero kya 8.5%.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
targetString: Okugezesa okw’enjawulo kwekkaanya eddagala eriddamu okukozesebwa eryayisibwa edda okujjanjaba omusujja, omwo nga mwe muli okunoonyereza kwa mirundi ena ku ddagala lya hydroxychloroquine oba chloroquine phosphate.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Eddagala erizzeemu okukozesebwa okurwanyisa akawuka lye lisinga okukozesebwa mu kunoonyereza kw’omu China omuli okugezeza kw’Omutendera III kwa mirundi 9 P ku remdesivir mu mawanga mangi okusinziira ku alipoota ku nkomerero y’Ogwokuna.

sourceString: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
targetString: Nga bakulemberwa Ekitongole ki-Bill and Melinda Gates wamu ne be bakolagana nabo nga bataddemu ssente eziwera miliyoni US$125 era nga bakwatagana n’Ekitongole ky’ensi yonna, World Health Organization, okunoonyereza COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator kwatandika mu Gwakusatu, nga basakirira okukulaakulanya eddagala okutegeera amangu, okwekaliriza, okukulaakulanya n’okwanguyako obujjanjabi obusoboka.

sourceString: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
targetString: Okunoonyereza kwa COVID-19 Okw’ekisawo okukolerwa awamu kwakolebwa okukwanaganya n’okwanguyaako ebiva mu kunoonyereza kw’ekisawo okw’ensi yonna mu bujjanjabi obusuubirwa okuvaamu ebirungi.

sourceString: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
targetString: Ku ntandikwa ya 2020, eddagala ery’enjawulo eryakolebwa okujjanjaba obulwadde obulala lyali liddamu okukogezesebwa oba okukulaakulanyizibwa mu kunoonyereza kw’ekisawo okupya okumalawo obulwadde bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Ku ddagala eryayisibwa edda (gamba nga hydroxychloroquine ery’omusujja), Okugezesa okw’omutendera III-IV kulaga mu bantu ebikumi n’enkumi abalwadde ba COVID-19 obusobosi bw’okwongezaayo enkozesa y’eddagala eryayisibwa edda okujjanjaba obulwadde bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
targetString: Ogwokuna 2020 we gwatandikira, obujjanjabi obusoboka 103 bwali mu kiseera ekitandikirwako oba ku mutendera gw’enkulaakulanya I-IV , omuli ebiva mu kugezesa k’eddagala lya mirundi 29 erisuubirwa mu Gwokuna.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.
targetString: Mu Gwokuna, Ekitongole ki-WHO kyatongoza enkwata y’Okunoonyereza okukolerwa awamu" mu mawanga 10 okwekaliriza amangu enkola y’eddagala mu balwadde ba COVID-19 eryali terinnaba kwetegerezebwa mu bujjanjabi bw’obulwadde bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
targetString: Waliwo eddagala erikendeeza ku muwendo gw’okufa?

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
targetString: Waliwo eddagala erikendeeza ku bbanga omuntu ly’abeera mu ddwaliro?

sourceString: Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
targetString: Obujjanjabi bukosa obwetaavu bw’abantu abalwadde ba COVID-19 abakwatiddwa yegu okuteekebwa ku byuma by’omukka- oba ku bujjanjabi obw’enjawulo?

sourceString: Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.
targetString: Eddagala ery’engeri eyo lisobola okukozesebwa okukendeeza ku bulwadde bwa COVID-19 mu bajjanjabi n’abantu abali mu bulabe obw’omaanyi obw’okufuna obulwadde obw’obulabe? okuwandiisa abalwadde ba COVID-19 kugonzebwa na kukozesa bubaka, omuli n’okukkiriza okwetaba mu kunooneyereza, ku mukutu gwa WHO.

sourceString: After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
targetString: Abakola ku kunoonyereza bwe bamala okumanya eddagala eririwo ku ddwaliro omukutu gwa WHO gulonda mu ngeri ya kulabira awo omulwadde ali ku ddwaliro eryo n’aweebwa eddagala ly’okugezesa oba n’assibwa ku bujjanjabi obwabulijjo obuli ku ddwaliro eryo okujjanjaba COVID-19.

sourceString: The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
targetString: Omusawo agezesa awandiika n’awaayo obubaka bw’okulondoola obukwata ku mbeera y’omulwadde n’obujjanjabi olwo ng’ayingiza obubaka ku mukutu gwa WHO.

sourceString: A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
targetString: Ekibiina ky’ensi yonna ekirondoozi eky’abasawo ba WHO kyekaliriza ebivaamu buli luvannyuma lw’ebbanga eggere olw’okuyambako okukola okusalawo ku bulungi n’enkola y’eddagala ly’okunoonyereza, n’okukyusa mu nteekateeka y’eddagala erigezesebwa oba okusemba obujjanjabi obukola obulungi.

sourceString: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okufaananako n’okwo okw’okukolera awamu okuli ku yintaneeti okuyitibwa "Discovery", kwatandikibwawo mu Gwokusatu March mu mawanga musanvu nga kukolebwa INSERM (Paris, France).Mu Gwokusatu, okusakirira okugezesa kw’okukolera awamu kwaweza miliyoni $108 okuva mu bantu kinnoomu 203,000, ebitongole ne gavumenti z’amawanga 45 agali mu kusakirira oba mu nzirukanya y’okunoonyereza.

sourceString: Numerous candidate drugs under study as "supportive" treatments to relieve discomfort during illness, such as NSAIDs or bronchodilators, are not included in the table below.
targetString: Eddagala lingi erisoboka erinoonyerezebwako eriyitibwa "eriyambako" (supportive) okuwewulako ku bulumi mu kiseera ky’obulwadde, gamba nga NSAIDs oba bronchodilators, tebulagiddwa mu mweso guno wammanga.

sourceString: Others in early-stage Phase II trials or numerous treatment candidates in Phase I trials, are also excluded.
targetString: Abalala mu Mutendera gw’okugezesa ogusookerako II oba obujjanjabi obuluubirirwa obw’enjawulo mu Mutendera I nabwo tebulagibwa.

sourceString: Drug candidates in Phase I-II trials have a low rate of success (under 12%) to pass through all trial phases to gain eventual approval.
targetString: Eddagala eriruubirirwa mu Mutendera I-II ogw’okugezesa bulimu ekigero ky’obuwanguzi ekyawansi (wansi wa 12%) okuyita mu mitendera gyonna olwo liryoke likakasibwe.

sourceString: Hydroxychloroquine is more commonly available than chloroquine in the United States.
targetString: Hydroxychloroquine lye lisinga chloroquine okulabika mu Amerika.

sourceString: Although several countries use chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for treatment of persons hospitalized with COVID-19, as of March 2020 the drug has not been formally approved through clinical trials in the United States.
targetString: Wadde ng’amawanga mangi gakozesa chloroquine oba hydroxychloroquine olw’okujjanjaba abantu abaaweebwa ebitanda mu malwaliro nga balina COVID-19, mu Gwokusatu 2020 eddagala eryo lyali terinnaba kutongozebwa mu butongole nga liyisibwa mu kugezesa kw’ekisawo mu Amerika.

sourceString: Chloroquine has been recommended by Chinese, South Korean and Italian health authorities for the treatment of COVID-19, although these agencies and the US CDC noted contraindications for people with heart disease or diabetes.
targetString: Chloroquine lisembebwa Aboobuyinza mu China, South Kore ne Italy olw’okujjanjaba COVID-19, weewaawo ng’ate amawanga ago ne CDC mu Amerika gaalimu obutakwatagana ku bantu abalwadde b’omutima oba abalina sukaali.

sourceString: Both drugs have extensive interactions with prescription drugs, affecting the therapeutic dose and disease mitigation.
targetString: Eddagala lyombi lirinamu obukolaganyi bwa maanyi n’eddagala eddala eriweebwa abalwadde, ekikosa doozi y’obujjanjabi n’okutangira ekirwadde.

sourceString: Some people have allergic reactions to these drugs.On 12 April, a preliminary clinical trial conducted at a hospital in Brazil was stopped when several people given high doses of chloroquine for COVID-19 infection developed irregular heart rates, causing 11 deaths.
targetString: Abantu abamu bafuukuuka emibiri nga baweereddwa eddagala eryo. Nga 12 Ogwokuna, okugezesa okusookerwako okwakolebwa ku ddwaliro mu Brazil kwayimirizibwa abantu abangi bwe baaweebwa doozi eyawaggulu eya chloroquine okujjanjaba COVID-19 baafuna enkuba y’omutima etali ya bulijjo, ekyaviirako abantu 11 okufa.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show that favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Okugezeza kw’omu China mu Wuhan ne Shenzhen kwalaga nti favipiravir kwali "kukola bulungi ku bulwadde".

sourceString: Of 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Abalwadde 35 mu Shenzhen baakeberwa nga tebalina bulwadde mu nnaku 4, so ng’ate obulwadde bwamala ennaku 11 mu balwadde 45 abataafuna ddagala eryo.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: Mu kunoonyereza okwakolebwa mu Wuhan ku balwadde 240 abalina yegu ekitundu baaweebwa favipiravir n’ekitundu ne bafuna umifenovir.

sourceString: The term "preclinical research" is defined by laboratory studies in vitro and in vivo, indicating a beginning stage for development of a vaccine, antiviral or monoclonal antibody therapy, such as experiments to determine effective doses and toxicity, before a candidate compound is advanced for safety and efficacy evaluation in humans.
targetString: Ekimiimo "okunoonyereza okukolebwa ng’okw’ekisawo tekunnaba (preclinical research)" kinnyonnyolwa mu kunoonyereza kw’omu ggezeserezo mu ngeri ya vivo ne vitro ekiraga omutendera ogusooka ogw’enkulaakulanya y’eddagala erigema, obujjanjabi antiviral oba monoclonal antibody, gamba ng’okugezesa okulaga doozi ezikola obulungi n’ekigero ky’obutwa, ng’eddagala erisuubirwa terinnaba kukakasibwa nti teririna bulabe era likola bulungi mu bantu.

sourceString: Some antibiotics may be repurposed as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Eddagala erirwanyisa obuwuka (antibiotics) liyinza okuddamu okukozeseba mu bujjanjabi bwa COVID-19:

sourceString: In March 2020, the main protease of the SARS-CoV-2 virus was identified as a target for post-infection drugs.
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu 2020, ekirungo kya protease ekikulu mu SARS-CoV-2 virus kyalabibwa ng’ekiruubirirwa mu ddagala ly’oluvannyuma bw’obulwadde.

sourceString: This enzyme is essential to the host cell to reproduce the ribonucleic acid of the virus.
targetString: Enzyme eyo nkulu nnyo mu kuzaalukanya ribonucleic acid ow’akawuka.

sourceString: To find the enzyme, scientists used the genome published by Chinese researchers in January 2020 to isolate the main protease.
targetString: Okusobola okuzuula enzyme, bannassaayansi baakozesa genome eyafulumizibwa abanoonyereza b’omu China mu Janwali 2020 okwawula protease enkulu.

sourceString: As a potential combination therapy, they are used together in two Phase III arms of the 2020 global Solidarity project on COVID-19.
targetString: Ng’obumu ku bujjanjabi obusoboka, bukozesebwa wamu mu kitundu ky’Omutendera III ogwa 2020 ogw’ensi yonna ogw’okukolera awamu ku COVID-19.

sourceString: A preliminary study in China of combined lopinavir and ritonavir found no effect in people hospitalized for COVID-19.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okwasooka mu China okwalimu lopinavir ne tekwazuula kukosebwa mu bantu abaaweebwa ebitanda olw’obulwadde bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: It is unclear yet whether conditions arising during pregnancy including diabetes, cardiac failure, hypercoagulability or hypertension might represent additional risk factors for pregnant people as they do for nonpregnant people.From the limited data available, vertical transmission during the third trimester probably does not occur, or only occurs very rarely.
targetString: Tekitegeerekeka oba ng’embeera eziva ku lubuto omuli ne sukaali, omutima okwesiba, hypercoagulability oba puleesa eyawaggulu biyinza okwognera obuzibu obulala eri abakyala abalina embuto nga bwe kikola ku batalina mbuto. okuva ku bubaka obufunda obuliwo, okusaasaanya obulwadde ku wiiki 28 kyandiba nga tekibaawo, oba nga kibaawo bbalirirwe.

sourceString: There is no data yet on early pregnancy.
targetString: Tewali kimanyiddwa kyonna ku bafuna embuto nga tebanneetuuka There is no data yet on early egnancy.

sourceString: Little evidence exists to permit any solid conclusions about the nature of COVID-19 infection in pregnancy.
targetString: Waliwo obubaka butono obuliwo obuwagira okukubira ku kikula kya COVID-19 mu balina embuto.

sourceString: A case series of 43 women from New York who tested positive for COVID-19 showed similar patterns to non-pregnant adults: 86% had mild disease, 9.3% had severe disease and 4.7% developed critical disease.
targetString: Abakyala abalwadde 43 okuva mu New York abaakeberwa nga balina COVID-19 bwavaamu ebifaanagana n’ebyo eby’abakulu abatalina mbuto: 86% baalina obulwadde butonotono, 9.3% baalina obulwadde obw’amaanyi ate 4.7% baafuna obulwadde obw’amaanyi.

sourceString: Fetal distress was reported in two.
targetString: Okutawaanyizibwa mu lubuto kwategeezebwa mu bakyala babiri.

sourceString: None of the women developed severe COVID-19 pneumonia or died.
targetString: Tewali mukyala n’omu yafuna yegu wa maanyi owa COVID-19 oba yafa.

sourceString: All of them had live birth pregnancies and no severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.
targetString: Bonna baazaala abaana nga balamu era tewali kubulwa mukka kwa maanyi (neonatal asphyxia) kwalabibwa.

sourceString: The samples of breast milk, amniotic fluid, cord blood and neonatal throat swab were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative.In another study on 15 pregnant women, majority of the patients presented with fever and cough, while laboratory tests yielded lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.
targetString: Sampolo z’amata g’amabeere, amniotic fluid, omusaayi gw’oku kkundi, swab y’omu mumiro gw’omwana eyaakazaalibwa zaakeberwa okulaba oba balina SARS-CoV-2, era ebyavaamu byalaga nti tebalina.Mu kunoonyereza okulala ku bakyala 15 ab’embuto, abalwadde abasinga abaalina olusujja n’okukolola ate okukebera kw’omu ggezeserezo kwalaga nti abalwadde 12 baalina 12.

sourceString: Computed tomography findings of these patients were consistent with previous reports of non-pregnant patients, consisting of ground-glass opacities at early stage.
targetString: Ebyazuulibwa okuyita mu bifaananyi bya kompyuta (Computed tomography) mu balwadde bano byali bikkaanya ne alipoota ezaasooka ku balwadde abatalina mbuto, omuli ground-glass opacities mu bbanga erisooka.

sourceString: Follow-up images after delivery showed no progression of pneumonia.Media reports indicate that over 100 women with COVID-19 might have delivered, and in March 2020, no maternal deaths were reported.
targetString: Ebifaananyi by’okulondoola oluvannyuma lw’okuzaala byalaga nti tewali kweyongera kwa yegu. Amawulire galaga nti abakyala abasukka abakyala 100 abalina COVID-19 bayinza okuba nga baazaala, era mu Gwokusatu 2020 tewali bakyala baafa.

sourceString: Their guidelines thus advise that any pregnant person admitted to hospital with a COVID-19 infection should receive at least 10 days of prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin after being discharged from the hospital.
targetString: Ebigobererwa byabwe bwe bityo biraga nti omuntu yenna alina olubuto aweebwa ekitanda mu ddwaliro ng’alina COVID-19 alina okufuna waakiri ennaku 10 eza prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin ng’amaze okusiibulwa mu ddwaliro.

sourceString: There are no data yet concerning the implications of COVID-19 infections for labour.
targetString: Tewanabaawo bubaka bulaga biva mu bulwadde bwa COVID-19 ku kuzaala.

sourceString: One infant girl born to a mother with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that she had been infected in utero and supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.
targetString: Omuwala omuto omu eyazaalibwa omukyala alina COVID-19 yalina IgM levels eza waggulu nga wayise essaawa bbiri oluvannyuma lw’okuzaala, nga kiraga nti obulwadde yali abuggye munda era nga kiraga nti waliwo obusosi bw’okusaasaanya okw’engeri eyo mu balwadde abamu.

sourceString: A small study involving 6 confirmed COVID-19 mothers showed no indication of SARS-COV-19 in their newborns' throats or serum but antibodies were present in neonatal blood sera samples, including IgM in two of the infants.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okutono omuli abakyala abazadde abalwadde 6 abakakasiddwa nga COVID-19 kwalaga nti abaana baabwe abaakazaalibwa tebaalina SARS-COV-19 mu mimiro gyabwe naye nga baalina abasirikale abalwanyisa obulwadde obwo mu sampolo z’omusaayi ogw’abaana abaakazaalibwa, omuli IgM mu baana abato babiri.

sourceString: This is not usually passed from mother to fetus so further research is required to know whether the virus crossed the placenta or whether placentas of women in the study were damaged or abnormal.
targetString: Kino tekitera kusiigibwa kuva ku maama eri omwana atannazaalibwa n’olwekyo okunoonyereza okusingawo kwetaagisa okumanya oba akawuka kaayita ku kitanyi oba ebitanyi by’abakazi mu kunoonyereza byali bikoseddwa oba nga si bya bulijjo.

sourceString: Since COVID-19 shows similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, it is likely that their effect on pregnancy are similar.
targetString: Olw’okuba COVID-19 alaga obubonero bwe bumu ne SARS-CoV ne MERS-CoV, kisobokera ddala nti byonna bikosa ab’embuto mu ngeri y’emu.

sourceString: Four of seven had first trimester miscarriage, two of five had fetal growth restriction in the second trimester, and four of five had preterm birth.
targetString: Bana ku musanvu baavaamu embuto mu myezi esatu egisooka, babiri ku bataano abaana baakonzibira mu mbuto mu myezi esatu ku mukaaga, ate bana ku bataano bazaala abaana nga tebatuuse.

sourceString: None of the newborns were infected with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Tewali baana bawere baalina bulwadde bwa SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A report of ten cases of MERS- CoV infection in pregnancy in Saudi Arabia showed that the clinical presentation is variable, from mild to severe infection.
targetString: Alipoota okuva ku balwadde ba MERS-CoV abaali embuto mu Saudi Arabia yalaga nti ebyayanjulwa abasawo bikyukakyuka, okuva ku bulwadde obutali bwa maanyi ate olulala ne birag obulwadde obw’amaanyi.

sourceString: The outcome was favorable in a majority of the cases, but the infant death rate was 27%.A recent review suggested that COVID-19 appeared to be less lethal to mothers and infants than SARS and MERS but that there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks' gestation.
targetString: Ebyafaamu byali birungi mu balwadde abasinga naye abato abaafa baali ku kigero kya 27%. Okwekaliriza okwakolebwa emabegako awo kwalaga nti COVID-19 alabika si wabulabe nnyo ku bakyala abazadde ne ku baana okusinga SARS ne MERS naye nti waliwo okweyongera kw’obulabe bw’okuzaala ng’olubuto terunnatuuka oluvannyuma lwa wiiki 28.

sourceString: The World Health Organization and  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention of the United States advises pregnant women to do the same things as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering cough, avoid interacting with sick people, cleaning hands with soap and water or sanitizer.
targetString: WHO ne CDC eby’omu Amerika biwa abakyala bazito amagezi okukola ekintu kye kimu ng’abantu abalala okwewala obulwadde, gamba ng’okubikka emimwa ng’okolola, okwewala okwetaba n’abantu abalwadde, okunaaba mu ngalo ne ssabbuuni n’amazzi oba ne sanitizer.

sourceString: A survey conducted in Shanghai among pregnant women in different trimesters of pregnancy identified a strong demand for online access to health information and services.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okwakolebwa mu Shangai mu bakyala abali embuto ez’ebbanga ery’enjawulo baalaba obwetaavu bwa maanyi obw’okufuna obubaka bw’ebyobulamu n’obuweereza.

sourceString: People expecting their first baby were more willing to have online consultation and guidance than who had previously given birth.The RCOG and RCM recommend that in-person appointments be deferred by 7 days after the start of symptoms of COVID-19 or 14 days if another person in the household has symptoms.
targetString: Abantu abaali basuubira omwana waabwe asooka baali beetegefu okufuna okuluŋŋamizibwa n’okwebuuza online okusinga abo abaali bazaddeko. RCOG ne RCM bisemba nti okulabagana okw’amaaso ku maaso kulina okuyimirizibwa okumala ennaku 7 oluvannyuma lw’okutandika kw’obubonero bwa COVID-19 oba ennaku 14 omuntu omulala mu maka bw’aba n’obubonero.

sourceString: Fever subsequently developed in three asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Olusujja lwagenda lukula mu balwadde basatu abataalabikirako bubonero.

sourceString: One patient who had tested negative subsequently became symptomatic postpartum and tested positive three days after the initial negative test.
targetString: Omulwadde omu eyali akebeddwa ne kirabika nti talina bulwadde oluvannyuma yalabikirako obubonero era bwe yakeberwa oluvannyuma lw’ennaku ssatu yalaga nti alina ng’ate yasooka kulaga nti talina bulwadde.

sourceString: The doctors conducting the screening recommended that in order to reduce infection and allocate PPE, due to high numbers of patients presenting as asymptomatic, universal screening of pregnant patients should be conducted.
targetString: Abasawo abakola okusunsulamu baasemba nti okusobola okukendeeza ku kukukosebwa n’okugaba ebyokwesabika, olw’omuwendo gw’abalwadde abangi abatalabikirako bubonero, okusunsula okw’abakyala ab’embuto kulina okukolebwa.

sourceString: They also suggest that people with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 should have continuous electronic fetal monitoring.
targetString: Era baateesa nti abantu abateeberezebwa oba abakasibwa nti balina COVID-19 balina okukolebwako okulondoola kw’omwana ali mu lubuto okwa buli kiseera.

sourceString: The use of birthing pools is not recommended for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 due to the risk of infection via faeces.
targetString: Okukozesa ebifo ebipiira ebinaabirwamu/okuwugiramu (birthing pools) tekisembebwa eri abateeberezebwa okubeera ne COVID-19 olw’obulabe bw’okukwatibwa obulwadde obuyita mu bubi.

sourceString: In the UK, official recommendations state that precautionary separation of a mother and a healthy baby should not be undertaken lightly and that they should be kept together in the postpartum period where neonatal care is not required.Literature from China recommended separation of infected mothers from babies for 14 days.
targetString: Mu Bungereza, ebisembebwa ebitongole biraga nti okweyawula okulimu okwegendereza eri omukyala n’omwana omulamu tebiteekwa kutwalibwa ng’ebyolusaago era nti balina okukuumibwa nga bali wamu ng’amaze okuzaala bwe kiba nti okulabirira omwana tekwetaagisa. Ebiwandiiko ebiva e China bisemba okwawula abakyala abazadde abalina obulwadde okuva ku baana baabwe okumala ennaku 14.

sourceString: In the US there is also the recommendation that newborns and mothers should be temporarily separated until transmission-based precautions are discontinued, and that where this is not possible the newborn should be kept 2 metres away from the mother.
targetString: Mu Amerika nayo waliwo okusemba nti abaana abazaalibwa ne bannyaabwe balina okwawulibwa okumala akaseera okutuusa ng’okwegendereza kw’okusaasaanya obulwadde kumaze okuggyibwawo, era nti kino we kitasobokera omwana eyakazaalibwa alina okukuumibwa nga yeesudde mmita 2 okuva ku nnyina.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.
targetString: okulondoola b'COVID-19 kutwaliramu okulondoola okusaasaana kw’obulwadde bwa coronavirus okusobola okulaba engeri obulwadde gye bweyongera mu maaso.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, with focus of case finding, testing and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.
targetString: Ekitongole kya World Health Organization (WHO) kisemba okulondoola okutakoma, nga essira liteekebwa ku kuzuula abantu, okubakebera n’okulondoola abeetabyeko n’abalwadde mu nkola zonna ez’okulwanyisa okusaasaanya endwadde.

sourceString: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
targetString: okuketta COVID-19 kusuubira okulondoola enseetuka y’ekirwadde, okukenga amangu abalwadde abapya, era okusinziira ku bubaka obwo obubaka obukwata ku bulwadde bufunibwe okusobola okwekaliriza obulabe era n’okuluŋŋamya okwetegekera obulwadde.

sourceString: Syndromic surveillance is done based on the symptoms of an individual that corresponds to COVID-19.
targetString: Okulondoola obubonero kukolebwa okusinziira ku bubonero bw’omuntu kinnoomu obukwatagana ne COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the WHO recommends the following case definitions:
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu 2020, WHO kisemba okunnyonnyola kino:

sourceString: Probable case : "A suspect case for whom testing for the COVID-19 virus is inconclusive" OR "a suspect case for whom testing could not be performed for any reason".
targetString: Omulwadde ateeberezebwa: "Ateeberezebwa okuba omulwadde naye ng’okukeberwa akawuka ka-COVID-19 tekulaga kyankomeredde" OBA "ateeberezebwa okuba omulwadde naye nga tasobola kukeberebwa olw’ensonga yonna".

sourceString: Confirmed case: "A person with laboratory confirmation of COVID-19 infection, irrespective of clinical signs and symptoms".
targetString: Omulwadde akakasiddwa: "Omuntu akebeddwa era ebivudde mu ggezeserezo ne bikakasa nti alina COVID-19, nga si nsonga oba alina bubonero bwa ngeri ki".

sourceString: Direct physical contact with a probable or confirmed case;
targetString: Okukwatagana obutereevu n’omuntu ateebererezebwa oba akakasiddwa okuba omulwadde;

sourceString: Direct care for a patient with probable or confirmed COVID-19 disease without using proper personal protective equipment;
targetString: Okulabirira omulwadde obutereevu ateeberezebwa oba akakasiddwa nti alina obulwadde bwa COVID-19 awatali kukozesa bibikka mubiri ebirungi;

sourceString: Other situations as indicated by local risk assessments".WHO recommends reporting of probable and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.
targetString: Embeera endala nga bwe ziragibwa ab’omu kitundu abakola ku kwekaliriza obulabe". WHO kisemba okutegeeza abateeberezebwa n’abakakasiddwa okubeera ne COVID-19 mu ssaawa 48 mwe baba balabiddwa.

sourceString: The countries should report on a case-by-case basis as far as possible, but in case of limitation in resources, aggregate weekly reporting is also possible.
targetString: Amawanga galina okuwa amawulire mulwadde-ku-mulwadde nga bwe kisoboka, naye bwe kiba ng’ebikozesebwa biremesa okukikola, okugatta emiwendo gya buli wiiki nakyo kisoboka.

sourceString: Some organizations have created crowdsourced apps for syndromic surveillance, where people can report their symptoms to help researchers map areas with concentration of COVID-19 symptoms.
targetString: Ebitongole ebimu bitonzeewo app eziyitibwa ‘crowdsourced apps’ okuketterako obubonero abantu mwe basobola okulagira obubonero bwabwe okuyambako okuyamba abanoonyereza okulabamba ebitundu ebirimu ennyo obubonero bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: Virological surveillance is done by using molecular tests for COVID-19.
targetString: Okuketta okunoonyereza ku buwuka kukolebwa na kukozesa kukebera kwa molecular okwa COVID-19.

sourceString: WHO has published resources for laboratories on how to perform testing for COVID-19.
targetString: WHO kyafulumya ebikozesebwa mu magezeserezo ku ngeri y’okukebera COVID-19.

sourceString: In the European Union, laboratory confirmed cases of COVID-19 are reported within 24 hours of identification.
targetString: Mu Mukago gwa Bulaaya, abalwadde abakaksiddwa n’okugezesa kw’omu ggezeserezo nga balina COVID-19 bategeezebwa mu ssaawa 24 mwe balabirwa.

sourceString: At least 24 countries have established digital surveillance of their citizens.
targetString: Amawanga waakiri 24 gatandewo okulondoola abantu baago okw’oku kompyuta.

sourceString: The digital surveillance technologies include apps, location data and electronic tags.
targetString: Okulondoola okwa kompyuta mulimu apps, obubaka obukwata ku kifo omuntu waali n’obulambi ku kompyuta.

sourceString: The Center For Disease Control and Prevention in USA tracks the travel information of individuals using airline passenger data.
targetString: CDC mu Amerika kirondoola obubaka obukwata ku ntambula z’omuntu kinnoomu nga bakozesa obubaka bw’entambula z’ennyonyi.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, authorities are requiring a bracelet and an app for all travellers.
targetString: Mu Hong Kong, aboobuyinza baagala okulaba buli mutambuze ng’alina akakomo ku mukono ne app.

sourceString: A GPS app is used to track the locations of individuals in South Korea to ensure against quarantine breach, sending alerts to the user and to authorities if people leave designated areas.
targetString: App ya GPS ekozesebwa okulondoola ebifo by’abantu kinnoomu mu South Korea okukakasa nti omuntu tadduka mu kalantiini, okuweereza okutemyako eri omukozesa n’aboobuyinza omuntu singa ava mu kifo ky’ateekeddwa okubeeramu.

sourceString: In Singapore, individuals have to report their locations with photographic proof.
targetString: Mu Singapore, abantu balina okulaga ebifo mwe bali nga beekuba n’ebifaananyi okukakasa kye bagamba.

sourceString: Thailand is using an app and SIM cards for all travelers to enforce their quarantine.
targetString: Thailand ekozesa app na kaadi za SIM ku batambuze bonna okukakasa nti bonna bali mu kalantiini.

sourceString: Human rights organizations have criticized some of these measures, asking the governments not to use the pandemic as a cover to introduce invasive digital surveillance.
targetString: Ebitongole ebirwanirira eddembe ly’obuntu bikolokose ezimu ku nkola zino nga bisaba gavumenti zireme kukozesa kiseera kya nawookeera ng’ekyekwaso ky’okuleetawo okulondoola kw’oku kompyuta okutyoboola.

sourceString: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.
targetString: Obuwuka bwa b'Coronavirus kibinja kya buwuka obufaanagana obuleeta endwadde mu bisolo n’ebinyonyi.

sourceString: In humans, coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal.
targetString: Mu bantu, obuwuka bwa coronavirus buleeta obukosefu ku bitundu ebissa obuyinza okuba obutonotono oba obw’omutawaana.

sourceString: Mild illnesses include some cases of the common cold (which has other possible causes, predominantly rhinoviruses), while more lethal varieties can cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.
targetString: Obulwadde obutonotono mulimu ssennyiga owa bulijjo (asobola okuleetebwa ebintu ebirala, okusingira ddala obuwuka bwa rhinovirus), so ng’ate obulwadde obwomutawaana busobola okulwaza SARS, MERS, ne COVID-19.

sourceString: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.
targetString: Obubonero mu bintu ebirala bwa njawulo: mu nkoko, buleeta obulwadde bw’okuyiriitira, so ng’ate mu nte n’embizzi bulwaza embiro.

sourceString: There are yet to be vaccines or antiviral drugs to prevent or treat human coronavirus infections.
targetString: Tewannabaawo ddagala ligema oba erirwanyisa obuwuka lizuulibwa okugema oba okujjanjaba akawuka ka coronavirus mu bantu.

sourceString: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Coronaviruses zikola famire eyitibwa Orthocoronavirinae, mu famire eyitibwa Coronaviridae, mu luggya lwa Nidovirales, ne realm eyitibwa Riboviria.

sourceString: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.
targetString: Buwuka obwesabika obulina oluguwa olumu RNA genome ne nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.

sourceString: The genome size of coronaviruses ranges from approximately 26 to 32 kilobases, one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Ekigero kya genome ya coronaviruses kiva kumpi kilobases 26 okutuuka ku 32, nga kye kimu ku bigero ebinene mu buwuka obw’ekika kya RNA.

sourceString: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.
targetString: Bwakula nga buliko engeri y’amaggwaggwa, nga bwekulungirivu era nga bukola ekifaananyi ekyefaananyirizaako sseŋŋendo, era wano we wava erinnya lyabwo.

sourceString: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).
targetString: Coronaviruses bwasooka kuzuulibwa mu 1930s obulwadde obw’amaanyi obukosa omussizo bwalabibwa ng’obuleetebwa akawuka akakosa emimiro akayitibwa infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).

sourceString: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
targetString: Mu myaka gya 1940, coronaviruses endala bbiri ez’omu nsolo, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) ne transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), zaalabibwa. Coronaviruses ez’omu bantu zaazuulwa mu myaka gya 1960.

sourceString: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
targetString: Ezaasooka okwekkaanyizibwa zaali mu bantu abalwadde abalina ssenyiga owabulijjo era oluvannyuma obwatuumibwa obuwuka bw’omu bantu ( human coronavirus 229E) ne human coronavirus OC43.

sourceString: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.
targetString: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.

sourceString: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
targetString: Obuwuka obulala obwa coronaviruses mu bantu buzze buzuulibwa, omuli SARS-CoV mu 2003, HCoV NL63 mu 2004, HKU1 mu 2005, MERS-CoV mu 2012, ne SARS-CoV-2 mu 2019.

sourceString: Most of these have involved serious respiratory tract infections.
targetString: Obusinga obungi ku buno buleseewo obulwadde obw’amaanyi obw’ekuusa ku kussa.

sourceString: The name was first used in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to designate the new family of viruses.
targetString: Erinnya eryo lyasooka kukozesebwa ekibinja ekitaali kitongole ekyabanonoyereza ku buwuka mu 1968 mu kiwandiiko ky’ekiyivu (journal) ekiyitibwa Nature nga batuuma ekika ky’obuwuka (family of viruses).

sourceString: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
targetString: Erinnya liraga enfaanana y’obuwuka obwo (enkula y’akawuka esiiga obulwadde) eringa bblubu y’ettaala nga kuliko obuntu obusongolerevu mu nfaanana ate nga mu bwekulungirivu kirina sseŋŋendo, era okwo kwe kuva erinnya solar corona.

sourceString: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
targetString: Enkula eno ereetebwa oluggwaggwa oluli kungulu kw’akawuka, oluyitibwa protein ku lususu lw’akawuka.

sourceString: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
targetString: Obuwuka bu-coronavirus bukyusakyusa mu nkula enneekulungirivu nga bulinga bbalubu naye nga buliko oluggwaggwa.

sourceString: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
targetString: Ekikuta ky’akawuka mu electron micrographs kifaanana nga electron dense shell bbiri. Ekikuta ky’akawuka okulususu olw’emirundi ebiri naye ng’eddiba (M), ekikuta (E) n’eriggwa (S) protein eziri mu kikula kyayo mwe zeekwata.

sourceString: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
targetString: Olusavu olukola ekikuta eky’emibiri ebiri, protein w’omuddiba ne nucleocapsid bikuuma akawuka nga kali bweru w’ekintu ku we keekwata.

sourceString: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
targetString: Coronaviruse bubeeramu oluguwa lwa RNA genome lumu.

sourceString: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
targetString: Ekigero kya genome ekya kiri wakati wa kilobases 26.4 okutuuka ku 31.7.

sourceString: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Ekigero kya genome kye kimu ku binene mu buwuka bwa RNA.

sourceString: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
targetString: Engeri y’okugabanya 1a ne 1b, ebeera mu bitundu byakusatu ebya genome, biraga replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.

sourceString: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
targetString: Replicase/transcriptase polyprotein byekwata okukola protein. Engabanya endala zibaamu protein ennya: spike, envelope, membrane, ne nucleocapsid.

sourceString: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
targetString: Ebibunye mu ngabanya zino z’engabanya za accessory proteins.

sourceString: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
targetString: Omuwendo gwa accessory protein n’omugaso gwazo ya njawulo okusinziira ku kika kya coronavirus.

sourceString: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
targetString: Obulwadde butandika ng’eriggwa (S) glycoprotein lyekwata ku kintu akawuka kwe kasaasaanira.

sourceString: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
targetString: Bwe kamala okwekwata, protease y’ekintu kwe kasaasaanira yeenyweza era ne kaleetera protein y’eriggwa okuvaayo.

sourceString: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
targetString: Okusinziira ku kataffaali ka protease akaliwo, okwekwata n’okuleetera protein okuvaayo kiganya akawuka okuyingria mu kataffaali k’ekintu kye keekutteko mu ngeri eyitibwa endocytosis oba okwesogga obutereevu mu kikuta ky’akawuka n’eddiba ly’ekintu kwe keekutte, ekitundu ky’akawuka kivaako olukuta, genome yaako n’eyingira mu cell cytoplasm.

sourceString: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
targetString: Ribosome y’ekintu ekyekwatibwako kifuula engabanya eyasooka eya genome y’akawuka ne kafuukamu polyprotein empanvu.

sourceString: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
targetString: Polyprotein erina proteases eyaayo eyeekwata ku polyprotein n’efuukamu protein endala nnyingi.

sourceString: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
targetString: Nonstructural protein zeegatta okukola multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).

sourceString: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
targetString: Replicase-transcriptase protein enkulu ye RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).

sourceString: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
targetString: Keetaba butereevu mu kwekubisaamu ne mu kufuukafuuka kwa RNA okuva mu luguwa lwa RNA.

sourceString: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
targetString: Nonstructural protein endala mu kwegatta okwo, ziyambako mu kuzaalukana ne mu nkwajja y’okufuukafuuka.

sourceString: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
targetString: Okugeza, protein eyitibwa Exoribonuclease nonstructural, ereeta okuzaalukana ng’ekola omulimu gwa proofreading ate nga RNA-dependent RNA polymerase tegulina. Ogumu ku mulimu omukulu ogw’ekigatte (complex) kwe kuzaalukanya genome y’akawuka.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: RdRp eyungirira butereevu synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA okuva mu positive-sense genomic RNA.

sourceString: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: Kino kiddirirwa okuzaalukana kwa positive-sense genomic RNA okuva mu negative-sense genomic RNA.

sourceString: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
targetString: Omugaso omulala omukulu ogw’ekigatte (complex) kwe kufuulafuula genome y’akawuka.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: RdRp eyungirira butereevu synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules okuva mu positive-sense genomic RNA.

sourceString: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
targetString: Kino kigobererwa okufuukafuuka negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules ne bukwatagana ne bunnaabwo bu-positive-sense mRNAs.

sourceString: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
targetString: Positive-sense genomic RNA ezaalukanyiziddwa efuuka genome ya progeny viruses.

sourceString: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
targetString: mRNAs biba bifuulefuule bya ndagabutonde eby’ekitundu ky’akawuka ebisembayo ebya genome oluvannyuma lw’engabanya esookerwako esibagana n’endala.

sourceString: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
targetString: mRNAs bufuulibwafuulibwa ne ribosomes z’ekintu akawuka kwe keekwata ne bufuukamu structural proteins ne accessory proteins eziwererako ddala.

sourceString: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
targetString: RNA translation ebeerawo munda mu endoplasmic reticulum.

sourceString: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
targetString: Viral structural proteins S, E, ne M zitambulira ku kakubo okuyita protein ne budda mu Golgi intermediate compartment.

sourceString: There, the M proteins direct most protein-protein interactions required for assembly of viruses following its binding to the nucleocapsid.
targetString: Awo, protein ez’ekika kya M ziruŋŋamya enkolagana ya protein esinga eyeetaagisa okukuŋŋaanya obuwuka nga kagoberera okwekwata kwako ku nucleocapsid.

sourceString: Progeny viruses are then released from the host cell by exocytosis through secretory vesicles.
targetString: Olwo ate Progeny viruses zifulumizibwa okuva ku ekyo ekyekwatibwako akawuka nga zikozesa exocytosis through secretory vesicles.

sourceString: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.
targetString: Enkolagana y’eriggwa lya protein ya coronavirus n’ekibeerako akawuka nkulu nnyo mu kusalawo ku tissue tropism, okusiiga obulwadde,n’ekigero ky’olunyiriri lw’akawuka.

sourceString: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.
targetString: Okugeza SARS coronavirus, erwaza obutaffaali bw’omuntu nga kayitira mu kwekwata ku angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.

sourceString: The scientific name for coronavirus is Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.
targetString: Erinnya ly’ekinnassaayansi erya coronavirus lye lino Orthocoronavirinae oba Coronavirinae.

sourceString: Coronaviruses belong to the family of Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Obuwuka bwa Coronaviruse bugwa mu kika kya Coronaviridae, omutuba (order) Nidovirales, ne realm Riboviria.

sourceString: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus
targetString: Mu ssiga (Genus) Betacoronavirus; mu lunyiriri (species): Murine coronavirus

sourceString: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)
targetString: Olunyiriri: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)

sourceString: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus
targetString: Olunyiriri: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as recently as 8000 BCE, although some models place the common ancestor as far back as 55 million years or more, implying long term coevolution with bat and avian species.
targetString: Jjajja wa coronavirus eyaakasembyeyo (MRCA) owa coronaviruses zonna ateeberezebwa okuba nga yaliwo mu mwaka gwa 8000 BCE, wadde ng’okunoonyereza okumu kulaga nti jjajja oyo owawamu yaliwo mabega ddala eyo emyaka miliyoni 55 oba n’okusingawo, kino nga kitegeeza nti bukyusekyuse nnyo wamu n’akawundo n’olunyiriri lwa avian.

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
targetString: Jjajja w’oluse lwa alphacoronavirus eyaakasembyeyo ateeberezebwa eyo mu mwaka gwa 2400 BCE, oluse lwa betacoronavirus luteeberezebwa eyo mu mwaka gwa 3300 BCE, oluse lwa gammacoronavirus mwaka gwa 2800 BCE, ate n’oluse lwa deltacoronavirus awo nga mu 3000 BCE.

sourceString: The large number of host bat and avian species, and their global range, has enabled extensive evolution and dissemination of coronaviruses.Many human coronavirus have their origin in bats.
targetString: Omuwendo gw’obuwundo obubeerako obuwuka n’olunyiriri lwa avian, n’enjawulo ezibirimu mu nsi yonna bisobozesezza enfuukafuuka ey’amaanyi n’okusaasaana kwa coronaviruses. Human Coronavirus nnyingi zisibuka mu buwundo.

sourceString: More recently, alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged sometime before 1960.
targetString: Emabegako awo, alpaca coronavirus ne human coronavirus 229E zaawukana ng’omwaka gwa 1960 tegunnaba.

sourceString: MERS-CoV emerged in humans from bats through the intermediate host of camels.
targetString: MERS-CoV kaalabikira mu bantu kava mu bwundo nga kayitira mu kibeerako obuwuka ekitasaanasaanya, eŋŋamiya.

sourceString: MERS-CoV, although related to several bat coronavirus species, appears to have diverged from these several centuries ago.
targetString: MERS-CoV, newankubadde nga kalina Oluganda ku lunyiriri lwa bat coronavirus species, kafaanana okuba nga kaawukana ku byasa bingi emabegako ddala.

sourceString: The most closely related bat coronavirus and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.
targetString: Bat coronavirus akasinga okuba n’oluganda olw’okumpi ennyo ke ka SARS-CoV akaafuuka mu 1986.

sourceString: A possible path of evolution, of SARS coronavirus and keen bat coronaviruses, suggests that SARS related coronaviruses coevolved in bats for a long time.
targetString: Omuyitiro gw’okufuukafuuka ogusoboka ogwa SARS coronavirus ne keen bat coronaviruses, gulaga nti obuwuka obwekwanya ku SARS bwafuukirafuukira mu buwundo okumala ebbanga ddene.

sourceString: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus diverged from the bovine coronavirus after a cross-species jump.
targetString: Mu myaka gya 1790, equine coronavirus yafuuka okuva mu bovine coronavirus oluvannyuma lw’okubuuka amacco olunyriri (cross-species jump).

sourceString: Later in the 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 diverged from bovine coronavirus after another cross-species spillover event.
targetString: Oluvannyuma mu myaka gya 1890, human coronavirus OC43 yafuuka okuva mu bovine coronavirus oluvannyuma lw’okubuuka okuva mu lunyiriri omulundi omulala.

sourceString: It is speculated that the flu pandemic of 1890 may have been caused by this spillover event, and not by the influenza virus, because of the related timing, neurological symptoms, and unknown causative agent of the pandemic.
targetString: Kiteeberezebwa nti nawookeera wa ssenyiga owa 1890 ayinza okuba nga yava mu kubuuka kw’akawuka okwo, so si kuleetebwa kawuka ka yegu (influenza virus), olw’okukwatagana mu budde, obubonero bw’emisiwa n’ebirala ebitamanyiddwa ebyavaako nawookeera.

sourceString: Human coronavirus OC43 besides causing respiratory infections is also suspected of playing a role in neurological diseases.
targetString: Human coronavirus OC43 ng’oggyeeko okuba nga kavaako okulwala kw’omussizo era kateeberezebwa okuba nga kazannya ekifo mu ndwadde z’emisiwa.

sourceString: In the 1950s, the human coronavirus OC43 began to diverge into its present genotypes.
targetString: Mu myaka gya 1950, human coronavirus OC43 kaatandika okufuuka nga koolekera genotypes ze kalina kati.

sourceString: Phylogentically, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), which infects the mouse's liver and the central nervous system, is related to  human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.
targetString: Mu ngeir y’obuwuka obuleeta endwadde, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), akakwataka ekibumba ky’emmese n’omuyungiro gw’emisiwa, kalina Oluganda ku human coronavirus OC43 ne bovine coronavirus.

sourceString: Human coronavirus HKU1, like the aforementioned viruses, also has its origins in rodents.
targetString: Akawuka ka Human coronavirus HKU1, era ng’obuwuka obwogeddwako waggulu, nako kasibuka mu mmese.

sourceString: Coronaviruses vary significantly in risk factor.
targetString: Obuwuka bwa Coronaviruses bwawukanira ddala mu ngeri gye bukosaamu.

sourceString: Some can kill more than 30% of those infected, such as MERS-CoV, and some are relatively harmless, such as the common cold.
targetString: Obumu busobola okutta abantu abasoba mu 30 ku kikumi ku abo abakwatiddwa, okugeza nga MERS-COV, ate obulala tebulina bulabe bwa maanyi, okugeza nga sennyiga owa bulijjo.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause colds with major symptoms, such as fever, and a sore throat from swollen adenoids.
targetString: Obuwuka bwa Coronaviruses busobola okulwaza sennyiga n’obubonero obw’amaanyi, okugeza nga olusujjasujja, n’amabwa mu mimiro nga kiva ku kuzimba adenoids.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause pneumonia (either direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (either direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).
targetString: Obuwuka bwa Coronaviruses busobola okulwaza lubyamira (nga omufuna butereevu oba nga akusiigibwa) n’okulwala amawugwe (ng’ofunye akawuka butereevu oba nga kakusiigiddwa).

sourceString: The human coronavirus discovered in 2003, SARS-CoV, which causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), has a unique pathogenesis because it causes both upper and lower respiratory tract infections.Six species of human coronaviruses are known, with one species subdivided into two different strains, making seven strains of human coronaviruses altogether.
targetString: Human coronavirus kaazuulibwa mu 2003, SARS-CoV, akaleeta severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), bulina endwadde ze buleeta ez’enjawulo kubanga buleeta obuzibu mu mussizo ogwa waggulu n’ogwa wansi. Ennyiriri mukaagaa eza human coronaviruses zimanyiddwa ng’olunyiriri olumu lweyawuddemu ebika bibiri, ebikola ebika musanvu ebya human coronaviruses byonna awamu.

sourceString: Four of these coronaviruses continually circulate in the human population and produce the generally mild symptoms of the common cold in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.
targetString: Coronavirus nnya ku ezo zeeyongera okusaasaana mu bantu era ne zireeta obubonero obutonotono nga ssenyigo owa bulijjo mu nsi yonna mu bakulu n’abanto: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.

sourceString: Coronaviruses cause about 15% of commons colds.
targetString: Coronavirus zireeta ebitundu nga 15% ebyassenyiga owa bulijjo.

sourceString: The majority of colds are caused by rhinoviruses.
targetString: Ssenyiga asinga aleetebwa.

sourceString: The four mild coronaviruses have a seasonal incidence occurring in the winter months in temperate climates.
targetString: Obuwuka obutali bwa maanyi obuna bulina ekiseera we bulabikira, mu bitundu ebyobunnyogovu bulabikira mu myezi egy’obunnyogovu.

sourceString: There is no preference towards a particular season in tropical climates.
targetString: Ate mu bitundu ebyebbugumu, tewali kiseera kye businga kwagala.

sourceString: Four human coronaviruses produce symptoms that are generally mild:
targetString: Okutwaliza awamu, obuwuka bwa human coronavirus buleeta obubonero butali bwa maanyi:

sourceString: The virus was officially named the SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).
targetString: Akawuka ako kaatuumibwa SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV) mu butongole.

sourceString: More than 8,000 people were infected, about ten percent of whom died.
targetString: Abantu abasukka mu 8,000 baalwala era ebitundu kkumi ku kikumi ku bo ne baafa.

sourceString: In September 2012, a new type of coronavirus was identified, initially called Novel Coronavirus 2012, and now officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Mu Gwomwenda 2012, akawuka akapya aka coronavirus kaalabibwa, mu kusooka kaayitibwa Novel Coronavirus 2012, naye kati mu butongole kaatumibwa Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

sourceString: The World Health Organization issued a global alert soon after.
targetString: Ekitongole ky’Ensi yonna eky’Ebyobulamu (WHO) mangu ago kyafulumya okulabula.

sourceString: The WHO update on 28 September 2012 said the virus did not seem to pass easily from person to person.
targetString: Amawulire ga WHO amapya nga 28 Ogwomwenda 2012 gaagamba nti akawuka kalabika tekatambula mangu kuva ku muntu omu kudda ku mulala.

sourceString: However, on 12 May 2013, a case of human-to-human transmission in France was confirmed by the French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.
targetString: Wabula, nga 12 Ogwokutaanu 2013, mu Bufalansa waalabikawo okusaasaana kw’akawuka kano nga kava ku muntu omu okudda ku mulala era kino kyakakasibwa Ministule ya Bufalansa ey’Ebyobulamu eyitibwa French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.

sourceString: In addition, cases of human-to-human transmission were reported by the Ministry of Health in Tunisia.
targetString: Mu ngeri y’emu, okusiiga okuva ku muntu omu okudda ku mulala kwalabika mu Tunisia era ekitongole ky’Ebyobulamu mu Tunisia ne kitegeeza bwe kityo.

sourceString: Two confirmed cases involved people who seemed to have caught the disease from their late father, who became ill after a visit to Qatar and Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Abalwadde ababiri abaakakasibwa baali bantu babiri abaalabika ng’obulwadde obwo baabuggya ku kitaabwe eyaafa, eyalwala ng’avudde mu lugendo lwe yaliko mu Qatar ne Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Despite this, it appears the virus had trouble spreading from human to human, as most individuals who are infected do not transmit the virus.
targetString: Wadde ng’ekyo kyaliwo, kirabika nti akawuka kaalina obuzibu okusaasaana okuva ku muntu omu okudda ku mulala, kubanga abantu abamu abalwala tebasiiga balala kawuka ako.

sourceString: The final name for the virus is Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Erinnya ly’akawuka erikakasiddwa lye lya Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

sourceString: The only U.S. cases (both survived) were recorded in May 2014.In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in the Republic of Korea, when a man who had traveled to the Middle East, visited four hospitals in the Seoul area to treat his illness.
targetString: Abalwadde bokka abaali mu Amerika (bombi baawona) baalabibwa muGwakutaanu 2014. Mu Gwokutaanu 2015, okubalukawo kwa MERS-CoV kwagwawo mu Korea, omusajja eyali agenzeeko mu Middle East, yagenda okujjanjabibwa mu malwaliro ana mu kitundu ky’e Seoul.

sourceString: This caused one of the largest outbreaks of MERS-CoV outside the Middle East.
targetString: Kino kyaleetawo okubalukawo kw’obulwadde bwa MERS-CoV, okumu ku okwo okukyasinze okuba okw’amaanyi ebweru wa Middle East.

sourceString: As of December 2019, 2,468 cases of MERS-CoV infection had been confirmed by laboratory tests, 851 of which were fatal, a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.
targetString: Mu Deesemba 2019, abalwadde 2,468 ba MERS-CoV baakakasibwa n’okukebera mu magezeserezo, abalwadde 851 baafa, bye 34.5% ku balwadde abo.

sourceString: In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak was reported in Wuhan, China.
targetString: Mu Deesemba 2019, lubyamira yabalukawo mu Wuhan, China era amawulire ne gafuluma.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel strain of coronavirus, which was given the interim name 2019-nCoV by the World Health Organization (WHO), later renamed SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.
targetString: Nga 31 Deesemba 2019, obulwadde obwo bwalondoolwa ne bukwanyizibwa ku bulwadde bwa coronavirus obwaliwo awo mu kitundu, era mu kiseera WHO ne kibuwa erinnya ery’ekiseera 2019-nCoV, oluvannyuma Akakiiko k’Ensi yonna Akanoonyereza ku Buwuka, International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses ne babutuuma SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Some researchers have suggested the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the original source of viral transmission to humans.As of 17 April 2020, there have been at least 153,822 confirmed deaths and more than 2,240,191 confirmed cases in the coronavirus pneumonia pandemic.
targetString: Abanoonyereza abamu balowooza nti akatale k’emmere akayitibwa Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market kayinza okuba nga si ye nsibuko y’okusaasaana kw’akawuka mu bantu. Olwa 17 Ogwokuna 2020 we lwatuukira, waakiri abantu nga 153,822 baali bafudde era n’abalwadde ba nawookeera wa lubyamula nga baweze 2,240,191.

sourceString: The Wuhan strain has been identified as a new strain of Betacoronavirus from group 2B with approximately 70% genetic similarity to the SARS-CoV.
targetString: Obulwadde bw’omu Wuhan bulabiddwa nga ng’obulwadde obupya obwa Betacoronavirus okuva mu kibinja 2B ng’ebitundu kumpi 70% eby’endagabutonde bifaanana ne SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The virus has a 96% similarity to a bat coronavirus, so it is widely suspected to originate from bats as well.
targetString: Akawuka kafaanana ne bat coronavirus ebitundu 96%,bwe katyo kateeberezebwa okuba nga nako kaava mu buwundo.

sourceString: The pandemic has resulted in travel restrictions and nationwide lockdowns in several countries.
targetString: Nawookeera aleeseewo okukugirwa mu ntambula wamu n’emiggalo egisaanira eggwanga eddamba mu mawanga mangi mu nsi.

sourceString: Coronaviruses have been recognized as causing pathological conditions in veterinary medicine since the 1930s.
targetString: Coronavirus zirabiddwa ng’ezireeta obulwadde mu nsolo okuva mu myaka gya 1930.

sourceString: Except for avian infectious bronchitis, the major related diseases have mainly an intestinal location.
targetString: Ng’oggyeeko obulwadde bwa avian infectious bronchitis, obulwadde obukulu obwefaanaanyiriza okusinga bubeera mu byenda.

sourceString: Coronaviruses primarily infect the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tract of mammals and birds.
targetString: Okusinga ennyo Coronavirus zikwata kitundu kya mussizo ekyawaggulu mu nsolo ne mu binyonyi.

sourceString: They also cause a range of diseases in farm animals and domesticated pets, some of which can be serious and are a threat to the farming industry.
targetString: Era zireeta n’obulwadde obw’enjawulo mu nsolo ezirundibwa n’obusolo obuzannyisibwa obubeera ewaka, obulwadde obwo obumu busobola okubeera obw’amaanyi era ne bukaluubiriza n’omulimu gw’obulunzi.

sourceString: In chickens, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), a coronavirus, targets not only the respiratory tract but also the urogenital tract.
targetString: Mu nkoko, akawuka kano infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), ak’ekika kya coronavirus, tekalumba mussizo gwokka wabula n’omuyitiro gw’omusulo (urogenital tract).

sourceString: The virus can spread to different organs throughout the chicken.
targetString: Akawuka kasobola okusaasaanira mu bitundu by’enkoko eby’enjawulo.

sourceString: Economically significant coronaviruses of farm animals include porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) and bovine coronavirus, which both result in diarrhea in young animals.
targetString: Mu byenfuna, obuwuka bu-coronavirus obulumba ensolo z’omu malundiro mulimu porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) ne bovine coronavirus, obuwuka bwombi obwo buleeta ekiddukano mu nsolo ento.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus: two forms, feline enteric coronavirus is a pathogen of minor clinical significance, but spontaneous mutation of this virus can result in feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), a disease associated with high mortality.
targetString: Feline coronavirus: karimu enkula za mirundi ebiri, feline enteric coronavirus kawuka akaleeta obulwadde akatatiisa nnyo, naye akasolo kano bwe kazaalukana ennyo kasobola okuleeta obulwadde obuyitibwa infectious peritonitis (FIP), obulwadde buno butta nnyo.

sourceString: Similarly, there are two types of coronavirus that infect ferrets: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes a gastrointestinal syndrome known as epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), and a more lethal systemic version of the virus (like FIP in cats) known as ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).
targetString: Mu ngeri y’emu, waliwo ebika bya coronavirus bibiri ebikosat ferret: Ferret enteric coronavirus kalwaza ebyenda (gastrointestinal syndrome) era obulwadde buno buyitibwa epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), ate kyo ekika ky’akawuka kano ekisinga okuba eky’obulabe (gamba nga FIP mu mmese) kiyitibwa ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).

sourceString: There are two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV), one that causes mild gastrointestinal disease and one that has been found to cause respiratory disease.
targetString: Waliwo ebika bibiri ebya canine coronavirus (CCoV), akamu kaleeta obulwadde obuyitibwa mild gastrointestinal n’akalala akazuuliddwa nga kaleeta obulwadde mu mussizo.

sourceString: Mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) is a coronavirus that causes an epidemic murine illness with high mortality, especially among colonies of laboratory mice.
targetString: Mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) kika kya coronavirus akaleeta epidemic murine illness, obulwadde buno butta okukamala, naddala mu Magana ga mususu ow’omu magezeserezo.

sourceString: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) is highly infectious coronavirus of laboratory rats, which can be transmitted between individuals by direct contact and indirectly by aerosol.
targetString: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) ko kawuka akaleeta ennyo obulwadde mu mmese z’omu ggezeserezo, obulwadde obwo busobola okusaasaanyizibwa abantu kinnoomu nga bakwataganye butereevu ate n’obutali butereevu okuyitira mu nnyindo (aerosol).

sourceString: Some strains of MHV cause a progressive demyelinating encephalitis in mice which has been used as a murine model for multiple sclerosis.
targetString: Obulwadde obumu obwa MHV buleeta progressive demyelinating encephalitis mu mususu akozeseddwa ng’ageraageranyizibwako (murine model) mu multiple sclerosis.

sourceString: Significant research efforts have been focused on elucidating the viral pathogenesis of these animal coronaviruses, especially by virologists interested in veterinary and zoonotic diseases.
targetString: Kaweefube w’okunoonyereza awerako ateereddwa mu kwongera okunnyonnyola enkula y’akawuka ak’omu nsolo (animal coronaviruses), naddala abanoonyereza ku buwuka abanoonyereza ku ntambula y’obulwadde okuva mu nsolo okudda mu bantu.

sourceString: Porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus of pigs, TGEV).
targetString: Akawukaka ka Porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus ow’omu mbizzi, TGEV).

sourceString: Bovine coronavirus (BCV), responsible for severe profuse enteritis in of young calves.
targetString: Akawuka ka Bovine coronavirus (BCV), akasaasaanya severe profuse enteritis mu nnyana.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) causes mild enteritis in cats as well as severe Feline infectious peritonitis (other variants of the same virus).
targetString: Akawuka ka Feline coronavirus (FCoV) kaleeta mild enteritis mu kkapa wamu ne mu severe Feline infectious peritonitis (ebika by’akawuka ako ebirala).

sourceString: the two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV) (one causing enteritis, the other found in respiratory diseases).
targetString: ebika bya canine coronavirus (CCoV) ebibiri (ekimu nga kireeta enteritis, ate ekirala kisangibwa mu bulwadde bw’omussizo).

sourceString: Turkey coronavirus (TCV) causes enteritis in turkeys.
targetString: Akawuka ka Turkey coronavirus (TCV) kaleeta enteritis mu ssekkoko.

sourceString: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes epizootic catarrhal enteritis in ferrets.
targetString: Akawuka ka Ferret enteric coronavirus kaleeta epizootic catarrhal enteritis mu busolo obufaananako kkapa (ferrets).

sourceString: Ferret systemic coronavirus causes FIP-like systemic syndrome in ferrets.
targetString: Akawuka ka Ferret systemic coronavirus kaleeta FIP-like systemic syndrome busolo obufaananako kkapa (ferrets).

sourceString: Rabbit enteric coronavirus causes acute gastrointestinal disease and diarrhea in young European rabbits.
targetString: Akawuka ka Rabbit enteric coronavirus kaleeta acute gastrointestinal disease n’ekiddukano mu bumyu bw’e Bungereza obuto.

sourceString: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED or PEDV), has emerged around the world.
targetString: Akakawuka ka Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED oba PEDV), kabuluseewo mu nsi yonna.
